title: Customer Support Representative for Software Platform (Remote)
description:
Welcome to UBA!

We are a rapidly growing software company seeking Customer Support Representatives to assist users of our digital platform. This position focuses on handling inbound messages, providing clear and friendly guidance, and ensuring users have a smooth experience with our software.



This role requires excellent written English, strong attention to detail, and the ability to follow structured communication guidelines. Comprehensive training will be provided so you can confidently support users and maintain consistent, high-quality service.



Key Responsibilities

Respond to user inquiries through our platform’s messaging system with clarity, professionalism, and a friendly tone.



Guide users through various platform features, basic troubleshooting steps, and general usage questions.



Build positive interactions with users to improve satisfaction and overall experience.



Follow internal communication templates, workflows, and escalation procedures.



Document conversations accurately and organize support tickets efficiently.



Collaborate with the support team to ensure smooth operations and share insights to improve the platform.



Keep up-to-date with software updates, feature changes, and company policies to provide accurate assistance.







Required Skills & Qualifications

Excellent written communication skills in English. Really excellent!



Ability to adapt writing style to match guidelines and brand tone.



Familiarity with online chat tools, CRM systems, or support platforms.



Strong attention to detail, reliability, and organizational skills.



Stable internet connection and ability to work from home effectively.



Ability to follow instructions closely and respond well to feedback.





Preferred Qualifications

Experience in customer service, sales, communication tech support, or online helpdesk roles.



Understanding of U.S. communication styles, slang, and casual tone when appropriate.



Ability to handle multiple conversations or tasks at once.



A proactive, solution-oriented mindset and strong emotional intelligence.



Interest in software, digital communication, or user-experience improvement.





Benefits

Competitive hourly rate ($2.50/$3 per hour + performance-based commissions).



Flexible remote working setup; night-shift availability is a strong advantage.



Performance incentives such as bonuses for quality, consistency, and user satisfaction.



Stable long-term position with opportunities for growth within the company.





How to Apply

Please complete the application form below and follow the instructions inside:

Application Form:

title: Bookkeeper – QuickBooks Online | 1PM–5PM EST | 20 Hours/Week
description:
We are a U.S.-based real estate and financial services group seeking a detail-oriented Bookkeeper with strong QuickBooks Online and reconciliation experience.



This is a long-term role for someone who values structure, consistency, and real-time collaboration.



This role focuses on structured cleanup, reconciliation, and ongoing monthly reporting.



Schedule:

• 1:00 PM – 5:00 PM EST

• Monday–Friday

• 20 hours per week

• Fixed schedule for real-time collaboration



Responsibilities

• Reconcile bank and credit card accounts

• Lead historical cleanup of accounts that are behind

• Review chart of accounts

• Identify discrepancies

• Maintain accurate financial records

• Prepare monthly P&L and Balance Sheet reports



Requirements

• Minimum 2–3 years QuickBooks Online experience

• Strong bank and credit card reconciliation experience

• Strong spoken and written English communication skills

• Available 1PM–5PM EST consistently

•Able to work independently and provide daily structured progress updates



Real estate accounting experience is a plus.



Compensation

• PHP 22,000 – PHP 28,000 per month

• Paid twice monthly via Wise

• Potential for increased hours after 90 days



How to Apply

To be considered:

-Send a message with the subject line: BK
Applications without this subject line will not be reviewed.

-Include a Google Drive link to your resume (PDF)

-Include a 2–3 minute video explaining your step-by-step process for reconciling an account with discrepancies



Shortlisted candidates will receive a follow-up questionnaire.

title: Vintage Buying Agent
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a vintage clothing brand sourcing unique pieces for resale to an international market. We are looking for a passionate, street-smart Buying Agent based in the Philippines — someone who lives and breathes thrift culture and knows how to spot a gem in a pile. If you love the hunt, this job is for you.



HOW YOU WILL SPEND YOUR TIME

90% — On-Ground Sourcing



5 days a week visiting ukay-ukay stores, tiangge markets, bazaars, and community sales



Identifying and purchasing vintage clothing that aligns with our brand aesthetic



Evaluating condition, fabric, print quality, and resale value of each piece



Building relationships with stall owners and vendors to get first access to new stock



Staying ahead of trends in the vintage market — what's moving, what's not



10% — Communication & Logistics

Sending regular photo updates and haul reports via messaging apps



Coordinating shipping of purchased inventory to our designated drop-off or shipping point



Tracking spend against a weekly buying budget and submitting simple expense reports



Flagging any standout grail pieces for approval before purchase



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Genuine love for vintage, thrift, and secondhand clothing culture



Strong eye for quality — able to assess fabric, condition, and print value quickly



Familiarity with ukay-ukay circuits, tiangge locations, and local market schedules



Self-motivated and comfortable working independently in the field



Reliable smartphone for photos and messaging via WhatsApp



Honest, trustworthy, and accountable with a buying budget



Basic English communication for photo captions and check-ins



COMPENSATION & LOGISTICS

Competitive monthly salary — commensurate with experience



Buying budget provided weekly — no out-of-pocket expenses required



Transportation and shipping costs reimbursed



5 days per week, flexible daily schedule based on market hours

Travel Visa Pro has a robust training program will provide ample informative training materials. Advancement will come with pay increase as well as commission opportunities.

, providing prompt & efficient assistance. Your primary focus will be to guide the client through the visa & passport process. You will be expertly trained on the documents, information & steps needed to guide the client to a successful order completion. 

The general order process steps are:

1.Call the client to "Activate the order" by introducing yourself & going over the steps in the order process & providing the order completion timeline.

3.Send the client an
 that summarizes the phone conversation & lists the needed information & documentation.

5.Submit the clients file to a form filler who will complete your clients forms for you.

6.Review the clients application & supporting documents for errors & take action to correct these errors.

7.Make any needed appointments for the client.

8.After the appointment,
 the client their PDF order file. Instruct the client to print the PDF, sign the application & use the included shipping label  to send their file to our V.I.P location for submission to the Embassy or U.S Department of State.

9.Monitor the clients submission progress & inform them when their completed order will arrive at their home.

10.After the order is complete, call the client to thank them for their business, answer any questions & ask them to review us!



If you excel at being proactive, following guidelines, meeting deadlines, de-escalation & resolving issues, upselling, follow-up, verbal/written communication & are committed to providing a positive customer experience, THIS IS THE JOB FOR YOU!

 as communication channels.

title: Recruiter
description:
Our client is on a mission to redefine the way job seekers embark on their next career adventure. As a Reverse Recruiter, you will be at the heart of this transformation. This unique role is designed for someone who wants to make a significant impact on individuals' professional lives, by bridging the gap between talent and opportunity. You'll partner closely with job seekers, diving deep into their professional backgrounds, aspirations, and preferences to proactively identify and secure opportunities that resonate with their career goals. Your expertise will turn the traditional job search process on its head, creating a personalized, supportive journey for each candidate.





Key Responsibilities:

Foster strong relationships with job seekers, becoming their trusted advisor and advocate in the job market.

Leverage your understanding of the candidates’ skills and goals to identify and secure job opportunities that align with their aspirations.

Develop and maintain a dynamic pipeline of eligible job posts for your client.

Assess job postings to ensure they meet the clients criteria and potential for success.

Act as the primary point of contact for clients, offering guidance and answering questions throughout their job search journey.

Achieve daily targets relating to job postings and applications processed.



Qualifications:

A Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred, showcasing your commitment to learning and professional development.

Exceptional proficiency in English, with the ability to convey complex ideas.

Outstanding organizational skills, with a knack for juggling multiple priorities seamlessly.

Innate interpersonal abilities, with a genuine passion for connecting with and supporting others.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, demonstrating your ability to navigate and utilize software to enhance productivity.

A track record of meeting and exceeding quotas, showing your dedication to achieving goals.

At least 2 years of experience in recruiting, indicating your understanding of the job market and talent acquisition strategies.

title: AI Automation Engineer / AI Agent Developer (OpenAI, LangChain, OpenCLAW, Python, AI Agents)
description:
We are looking for a high-performance AI Automation Engineer who lives at the cutting edge of AI and agent development.



This is NOT a beginner role.

This is for someone obsessed with AI, constantly learning, and actively building with the latest tools.



Our company is building AI-powered operational systems across CRM, marketing, outbound prospecting, and client management. We want someone who can spin up AI agents, integrate them into real workflows, and continuously improve them as the AI landscape evolves.

You are:

• Deeply curious about AI and emerging technologies

• A fast learner who can self-educate quickly

• Proactive and not dependent on step-by-step instructions

• Extremely resourceful and solution-oriented



You actively follow:

• AI developments on X 
)

• New agent frameworks and automation tools



REQUIRED SKILLS (KEYWORD OPTIMIZED):

• Python (automation & API integrations)

• AI Agent frameworks (LangChain, AutoGen, OpenCLAW, etc.)

• OpenAI API / LLM integrations

• Workflow automation (Zapier, Make, custom scripts)

• API integrations and system architecture

• Prompt engineering + agent logic design

• Database handling (Airtable, SQL, or similar)

BONUS (STRONGLY PREFERRED):

• Experience with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS)

Tools/frameworks you actively use for AI agents

title: Agentic Workflow Engineer (OpenClaw + Business Automation) — Long-Term Partner
description:

We want a partner in crime who can architect, ship, and continuously improve agentic systems that produce measurable business outcomes.

• CRM/database organization and enrichment

• Call transcription + AI training coach from successful calls

• Morning debrief summaries and accountability workflows

• KPI dashboards and alerting

• Task creation + owner assignment + overdue tracking

• Internal software tooling where off-the-shelf tools fall short



Core Responsibilities



• Architect agentic workflows (planning, tool-calling, memory/state, retries, approvals)

• Build deterministic pipelines (not just prompt chains)

• Integrate APIs, CRMs,
/SMS, and dashboards

• We move fast and value builders over talkers

title: Legal Assistant
description:
Legal Assistant – Job Description 

Position Type: Full-Time 

Time Zone: US Eastern 

Employer: Geiger Legal Group, LLC 



Position Summary: 



The Legal Assistant plays a vital role in supporting attorneys and paralegals through administrative and client-facing tasks across all stages of a personal injury case. This position ensures the smooth operation of case files, supports client communication, and facilitates prompt and accurate case progression. Success in this role requires self-starter, proactive mindset, attention to detail, and strong communication skills. 



Key Responsibilities: 



Client & Communication Support 

-Answer and route incoming calls, including overflow and intake calls when designated staff are unavailable. 

-Contact existing clients in the treatment phase at least biweekly to provide updates and ensure ongoing communication. 



Insurance & Claims Processing 

-Initiate and manage insurance claims, including obtaining liability, UM (Uninsured Motorist), and MedPay adjuster details. 

-Draft and send Letters of Representation to liability and UM carriers, and to health insurance providers. 

-Submit letters to healthcare providers instructing billing through health insurance when applicable. 

-Submit subrogation letters to lienholders and confirm balances prior to settlement. 



Case File & Document Management 

-Draft and send open records requests for dash cam, body cam footage, and case disposition records. 

-Enter and update all client-related information, including initial damages, health insurance, and provider contact details into the case management system (Litify preferred). 

-Draft and send initial requests for medical bills and records. 

-Finalize and confir
dical balances with providers following case resolution. 

-Prepare and send file close-out letters at the conclusion of cases. 



Qualifications & Experience

-Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) preferred. 

-One-two years experience in a legal, administrative, or customer-facing role strongly preferred. 

-If you are interested in applying, please send a message on the Onlinejobs.ph site with a link to a video introducing yourself and telling me about your Personal Injury law firm experience and your favorite hobby outside of work. In the subject line of the message write "The link to the video you requested!"



Skills & Competencies 

-A self-starter, go-getter spirit.

-Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.

title: Senior Canva Graphic Designer
description:
Marketing Designer: A successful candidate will have 2-4 years of experience executing marketing designs within an established brand system, with a strong ability to translate provided direction, templates, and copy into polished, ready-to-publish assets.



Position Type: Independent Contractor



Location: Remote, Must be located in the Philippines



Rate: $8USD / hour



Estimated weekly hours: 5-10



This role might be perfect for you if you have a strong professional background in digital design. This truly isn't a role for the casual designer or someone without some corporate experience.



Please review the position below and let me know if you are interested. I will then send you the link to apply on our careers page. Once you have applied on our careers page, you will receive a pre-screen survey that must be completed AND an
 with questions and a video request. We are moving quickly on this position and the faster you complete everything, the faster we can get the seats filled!!!



How do you know if this is your dream work and if Fertility Bridge is your dream client? If you think you can achieve these outcomes, this just might be the place for you:



Deliver consistent, on-brand assets that are ready to publish, up to 25 per week. High quality Canva designs using established templates, minimal editing, correct brand typography/colours, and balanced layouts even when copy varies. Patterns that indicate misalignment include off-brand elements, recurring rework, overlooking details, or avoidable design issues. Designers who excel take initiative on small improvements and steadily reduce the amount of editing and oversight needed by the Brand Manager.



Maintain a visually varied, professional feed through strategic design rotation for up to 15 posts per week. Designer will use rotating templates, layouts, typography treatments, and colour usage so the feed never looks repetitive or template-locked, even when posting daily. Patterns that indicate misalignment include when posts look identical across campaigns or lack variation over time. Designers who excel show proactive refinement of visual patterns and contributions to elevate the brand’s overall aesthetic.



Translate marketing strategy into clear, effective visuals, using existing or new assets, up to 25 per week. Direction from the marketing team will be converted into polished, on-strategy designs created in Canva without needing step-by-step guidance, and reducing oversight by Brand Manager over time. Patterns that indicate misalignment include when the intent of a campaign isn’t reflected or when repeated rework is needed to meet the brief. Designers who excel expand the creative library, introduce thoughtful visual variations, and take on asset/email design with increasing independence.

High-authority, education-driven YouTube content.

title: Government Compliance & Proposal Specialist
description:
Position: Government Compliance & Proposal Specialist

Location: Remote – US-Based Company

Schedule: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST



We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Government Compliance & Proposal Specialist to support our growing government contracting operations. The ideal candidate has strong knowledge of federal, state, and local procurement processes and experience managing proposal submissions, compliance documentation, and vendor registrations across multiple government platforms.



Key Responsibilities



Government Contract & Compliance Management

• Ensure company compliance with federal, state, and local procurement regulations and requirements

• Review solicitation requirements and develop compliance checklists

• Manage certifications, licenses, and renewals (SAM, SBA, state/local certifications, etc.)

• Register and maintain company profiles in government portals and procurement systems



Proposal Development & Submission

• Prepare, coordinate, and submit complete and compliant bid proposals (RFPs, RFQs, ITBs)

• Compile technical documents, forms, pricing sheets, and supporting attachments

• Track deadlines and manage submission schedules to ensure timely delivery

• Maintain organized proposal libraries and templates for future use



Opportunity & Market Research

• Source and monitor new opportunities through SAM, BidPrime, and other procurement platforms

• Analyze bid requirements and determine eligibility and competitiveness

• Provide opportunity summaries and recommendations to management



Procurement & Vendor Coordination

• Communicate with vendors and subcontractors for pricing, quotes, and documentation

• Perform cost analysis and pricing comparisons to support competitive proposals

• Support subcontractor outreach and participation requirements



Project & Document Management

• Coordinate internal teams to gather technical inputs and documentation

• Track project milestones from opportunity identification to award

• Maintain accurate records of bids, contracts, and correspondence

• Generate procurement and performance reports for management review





Requirements

• Proven experience in government contracting, procurement, or proposal management

• Strong knowledge of 
, BidPrime, and government bidding procedures

• Experience with compliance documentation and certification processes

• Ability to interpret solicitations and prepare compliant proposals

• Excellent organizational and time-management skills

• Strong analytical, negotiation, and communication abilities

• Ability to work independently and manage multiple deadlines simultaneously

• CF APMP

title: Senior Bookkeeper / Accounting Firm

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Title: Virtual Executive Assistant to Founder & Managing Director

Reports to: Founder & Managing Director, Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners

Employment Type: Part-Time (30-40 hours/week, with potential to grow into Full-Time)



About Us:



Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners is a boutique executive search firm specializing in placing C-suite and senior leadership talent into founder-led and private equity-backed companies. We partner closely with dynamic, high-growth businesses and investors across North America to deliver high-touch, strategically aligned search services.



Position Summary:



We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Virtual Executive Assistant to support the Founder & Managing Director across a range of administrative, operational, and client-facing responsibilities. This role requires impeccable attention to detail, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple workflows in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.



You’ll be responsible for everything from calendar and inbox management to sales deck preparation, client coordination, CRM upkeep, and light bookkeeping. This is a critical support role for someone who thrives behind the scenes helping a busy executive stay organized, responsive, and effective.



Key Responsibilities:



Executive Support

Manage and coordinate a busy, ever-changing calendar across multiple time zones





Monitor and organize inbox daily; draft responses, flag priorities, and help maintain follow-through





Prepare daily briefings, agendas, and materials to ensure the executive is fully prepped for meetings





Client & Candidate Coordination

Schedule candidate interviews and client meetings, often across multiple time zones





Assist with meeting logistics, follow-ups, and delivery of prep materials





Support communications with high-level candidates, clients, and referral partners





Administrative & Operational Support

Build and send NDAs, proposals, and contracts using templates





Maintain digital file organization and internal documentation





Assist in organizing inbox, Google Workspace and CRM (Mailchimp) to ensure up-to-date tracking of deals, candidates, and leads





Bookkeeping & Invoicing

Generate and send invoices using QuickBooks Online





Track payments and assist with follow-up on outstanding balances





Assist with basic bookkeeping and reconciliation of expenses





Sales & Marketing Support

Assist with the creation of polished sales pitch decks and presentations (Google Slides / Qwilr)





Maintain and update templates in QWILR or similar platforms (e.g., Adobe Photoshop)





Help with
 campaign tracking, lead list organization, and outbound sales workflows in Mailchimp





Conduct light research for prospects, market insights, and sales materials



Create and manage LinkedIn Posts, manage the company LinkedIn page



Handle simple website updates via Wordpress





Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in a remote Executive Assistant role





Experience supporting a founder, CEO, partner, or managing director strongly preferred





Prior experience supporting executives within executive search and/or consulting is a major plus





Required tools:





QuickBooks Online





Mailchimp CRM





Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Slides, Sheets)





Experience using QWILR, Adobe Photoshop or similar design platforms (e.g., Canva, Pitch, Notion) is a huge plus



LinkedIn Marketing Experience



Strong writing and editing skills in English; must be fluent and professional in tone





Highly organized and resourceful; able to work independently and manage shifting priorities





Trustworthy and discreet with access to confidential business information





Must be willing to work U.S. business hours



**If you are interested, please reply with an updated copy of your CV and a quick video to show communication skills**

title: Executive Search Recruiter and Research Analyst
description:
Summary

Job Title: Executive Search Research Analyst & Administrative Coordinator

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Part Time / Full-Time

Reports To: Founder & Managing Director



About Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners

Crimson Jay Executive Search Partners is a retained executive search firm based in the United States that partners with founder-led and investor-backed companies to recruit transformational financial and operational leaders. We specialize in acquiring top-tier talent across the C-suite and VP-level—particularly CFOs, COOs, and functional executives—who drive scalable growth and successful exits for high-growth businesses. Our clients are typically small to mid-market companies with revenues under $500M, most commonly between $1M and $200M, across industries like B2B services, software/SaaS, manufacturing, and financial services.



We are known for our white-glove, hands-on approach, our structured and transparent process, and our obsession with delivering results. We are now looking for a sharp, detail-oriented, and resourceful professional to join us in a critical research and administrative capacity.



Role Overview

The Executive Search Research Analyst & Administrative Coordinator will play a vital dual role supporting both candidate research and firm operations. This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the Founder in a high-touch executive search environment. You’ll be responsible for identifying talent, supporting active search engagements, and helping manage day-to-day operations that enable high-impact client delivery.



Key Responsibilities



Research & Candidate Identification



Build and maintain target lists, market maps, and org charts of executive leadership teams at relevant companies.



Conduct deep candidate sourcing using LinkedIn Recruiter, search strings, market intel, and research tools.



Monitor industry movement, executive transitions, and deal activity in private equity, venture capital, and M&A spaces to identify new opportunities and talent.



Compile and organize research briefs, company profiles, and competitor intelligence.



Candidate Process Support



Maintain detailed records in the firm’s CRM/ATS (Loxo) and keep search pipelines up to date.



Support the development of candidate scorecards, summaries, and job transition documentation.



Assist in scheduling candidate interviews and preparing interview guides and presentations for clients.



Help manage reference checks, background verifications, and candidate communications.



Administrative & Operational Coordination



Provide executive support to the Founder including scheduling, inbox management, and project tracking.



Create, edit, and format client-facing documents including job profiles, pitch decks, and candidate presentations.



Track deliverables, project timelines, invoices, and status updates to ensure smooth execution across all searches.



Help improve internal documentation, templates, and SOPs as the firm scales.



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree required; preferred background in business, communications, or a research-intensive field.



2-5 years of experience in executive search, recruiting, research, or professional services preferred.



Exceptional attention to detail and organizational discipline.



Highly proficient with Google Workspace, LinkedIn Recruiter, and web-based research.



Familiarity with CRM/ATS platforms (e.g., Loxo) a plus.



Clear, concise writing and communication skills are essential.



Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.



Who You Are



A rigorous thinker with strong intellectual curiosity and follow-through.



A proactive contributor who thrives with autonomy and accountability.



A high-integrity professional who treats confidential information with discretion.



A behind-the-scenes operator who takes pride in enabling great work and building something meaningful.



Why Join Crimson Jay

You’ll be joining a founder-led firm in high-growth mode, working on mission-critical searches that shape the future of small and mid-sized companies. You’ll gain exposure to high-level executive leadership, private equity firms, and top-tier operators—while building search and business operations experience in a performance-driven but human, flexible culture.

This role focuses on product form, brand expression, CMF, and user experience. You will translate brand strategy into iconic, emotionally compelling physical products that stand out in competitive global markets.

From premium hair dryers to precision power tools, you will shape a cohesive and recognizable design language that defines who we are — while working closely with our product development team to ensure your vision is thoughtfully executed.

title: Customer Service Manager
description:
Ikigai Cases is hiring for a Customer Service Manager

Location: Remote

Compensation: $1800 per month + performance-based bonuses



About the Company

Ikigai Cases (
) is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu
tal pill cases. Founded in December 2021, the business has been operated by two brothers from Washington, DC since then. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



We are looking to hire a Customer Service Manager to join our growing remote team.



5 Core Responsibilities

Elite Decision-Making & Judgment: Make consistently correct judgment calls in ambiguous customer situations where policies do not explicitly apply, setting clear precedent that protects the customer experience while maintaining company standards.



Elite Customer Service Execution: Confidently step into any customer ticket—new, escalated, or mid-thread—and resolve it correctly. Serve as the final escalation point for complex, high-risk, or high-value customer issues.



Template & Response System Ownership: Continuously convert real customer interactions into high-quality templates, macros, and decision guides that eliminate repeat mistakes and dramatically increase team efficiency.



Customer Service System Builder: Own and improve the customer service ecosystem end-to-end, including tools, workflows, tagging, reporting, policies, cheat sheets, and escalation paths, turning daily chaos into structured, scalable systems.



Head of Training, Coaching & Performance: Hire, onboard, train, coach, and performance-manage customer service representatives. Develop A-players, correct underperformance early, and maintain a consistently high bar across the team.



Why You Should Take This Role

-You’ll be working at a brand that is obsessed with their customers and has built a loyal following. Just read a few of their reviews: 

-You’ll be working at a company that has scaled up extremely quickly - while focusing on the operational side of the business. Now that the operations are stabilized with key roles in place, we are focused on investing in growth.

-You’ll be working with people who have extreme levels of competitive fire in their bellies - people who will run through walls to make sure the company succeeds.

-You’ll be working hand-in-hand with the founders of the company - building the systems and growth strategy together.

-You’ll be working at a company with a robust product development roadmap that includes new colors / products releasing monthly



Required Experience & Skills Experience

-3+ years served as a Customer Service Manager or Lead, managing a team of 6+ customer service representatives handling high-volume
-based support for a U.S.-based e-commerce brand.

-Extensive hands-on ticket experience — not removed from the queue — with a history of personally handling escalations and complex customer cases.

-Long-term ownership of CS documentation, including building and maintaining SOPs, templates, macros, and internal cheat sheets used daily by a CS team.

-Direct responsibility for training CSRs, including onboarding new hires, running ongoing coaching, and reinforcing standards over time.

-Multiple years of Shopify usage, including order review, edits, refunds, replacements, and understanding fulfillment states.

-Daily use of a helpdesk platform such as HelpScout, Gorgias, Zendesk, or similar, in a real production environment.

-Experience operating within a growing e-commerce team, where customer service decisions had real downstream impact on operations, fulfillment, and revenue.

-Must be based outside the United States.



Communication & English Proficiency 

-Strong written and verbal English skills.

title: Customer Support Rep E-Commerce Jewellery
description:
About Us



We are a jewelry brand dedicated to delivering high-quality pieces and an exceptional experience to our customers. Our customers aren't just buying products; they are buying gifts, memories, and sentimental items. We need a support representative who understands the importance of that relationship.





The Role



We are looking for a dedicated, sharp, and empathetic Customer Support Representative to join our team. You will be the primary point of contact for our customers, helping them with everything from ring sizing and material questions to shipping updates and returns.



We are not looking for a robot who uses copy-paste templates. We need a problem solver, someone who is caring enough to make the customer feel valued, but smart enough to protect the business and find practical solutions.





What We Are Looking For



Detail-Oriented: Jewelry orders require precision. You need to spot address errors, sizing issues, or special requests instantly.



A Problem Solver: You don’t just say "I don't know." You research, troubleshoot, and find the answer.



Pragmatic: You understand how to balance customer happiness with business policies. You can de-escalate a situation and find a solution that doesn't always involve a full refund.



Articulate Writer: You have excellent grammar and can adjust your tone to be professional, warm, and clear.





Responsibilities



Manage customer inquiries via 
/Social Media] regarding orders, shipping, and product details.



Manage social media comments.



Assist customers with product knowledge (e.g., sizing, materials, care instructions).



Handle returns and exchange requests efficiently, following company policies while maintaining customer goodwill.



De-escalate situations with frustrated customers regarding shipping delays or defects.





Requirements



- English Proficiency: C1 or C2.

- Experience with Shopify and Helpdesk tools (Gorgias, Zendesk, or Intercom) is a plus.

- Stable Internet: Reliable high-speed internet connection and a backup plan for power outages.

title: Digital Marketing & Community Manager (Human-First Community + Content + Digital Marketing Wizard))
description:
Part-time · Remote (Philippines)

15–20 hours/week (potential to grow to full-time)

EdTech / AI



ABOUT CHIPI

Chipi is an AI-native education platform for children and families. We help kids learn through guided activities, creative exploration, and interactive lessons in a safe, trustworthy environment.



We use automation to help generate and distribute content, but community engagement, tone, and trust are human-led. This role exists to make sure parents, educators, and users feel like they are interacting with a real, thoughtful team.



ABOUT THE ROLE

This is a human-first community role with light growth responsibilities.



You will be the friendly, reliable voice of Chipi across social platforms and community channels. You will engage with parents and educators, respond to questions, moderate discussions, and help the brand feel warm, safe, and trustworthy.



Automation supports this role, but it does not replace judgment. You will oversee automated content outputs and ensure they align with our tone and values.



WHAT YOU WILL DO – COMMUNITY

- Engage with parents, teachers, and users on social platforms

- Respond to comments, messages, and questions clearly and kindly

- Moderate discussions with safety and tone in mind

- Help users feel heard, supported, and informed

- Escalate issues or concerns when appropriate



WHAT YOU WILL DO – CONTENT AND GROWTH SUPPORT

- Review automated content before or after posting

- Flag tone, clarity, or alignment issues

- Suggest improvements to content in plain language

- Help run small community initiatives such as highlights, shoutouts, or simple contests

- Capture common questions, feedback, and sentiment and share them with the team



WHAT YOU WILL NOT DO

- Build or maintain automation workflows

- Write long-form marketing strategies

- Run paid advertising campaigns

- Focus on vanity metrics or growth hacking tactics



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Strong written English with a friendly, natural tone

- Experience engaging online communities or social media pages

- Comfortable communicating with parents and educators

- Good judgment and emotional intelligence

- Calm, thoughtful responses to feedback or confusion

- Organized enough to track conversations and follow up when needed



NICE TO HAVE

- Experience with education, parenting, or EdTech communities

- Experience moderating groups or pages

- Familiarity with AI or content tools (non-technical)

- Experience supporting a small brand or startup



HOW WE MEASURE SUCCESS

- Community feels active, responsive, and welcoming

- Questions and messages are answered promptly

- Tone remains consistent and trustworthy

- Useful feedback flows back into product decisions



WORKING STYLE

- Human-first and empathetic

- Responsible and independent

- Comfortable acting without constant direction

- Knows when to respond directly and when to escalate



HOW TO APPLY

Please include:

- A short note explaining why you enjoy community-focused work

- An example of a community, page, or group you have helped manage (if applicable)

- Your weekly availability

title: Marketing Agency Fulfillment Coordinator
description:
About Us

We are a U.S.-based digital marketing agency serving residential contractors (outdoor living, hardscaping, roofing, etc.). We help our clients grow through paid advertising, strong backend systems, and disciplined execution. 

Our team uses a specialist model — media buying, creative, client success, sales, and technical work are handled by experts. This role exists to ensure execution stays organized, systems function properly, and nothing falls through the cracks.



Role Overview

We are looking for a highly organized, detail-driven Business Operations & Fulfillment Coordinator to support day-to-day delivery, onboarding, and operational execution across our client accounts and internal systems.

This is an implementation and coordination role, not a strategy or leadership position. You will not be responsible for developing marketing strategy or making company-level decisions. Instead, your responsibility is to ensure that plans are executed correctly, systems function as intended, tasks are fully completed, documentation and SOPs are up-to-date and accurate, and work moves smoothly and efficiently between tea
mbers without breakdowns.

You will translate direction into action; verify that execution meets standards; maintain clean documentation and workflows; and help ensure that nothing falls through the cracks. Success in this role means our specialists can focus on their areas of expertise, because the operational engine behind them is organized, accurate, and consistently moving forward.

Think of this role as the coordinator of execution — keeping the systems, tools, and day-to-day work running reliably as the company grows.



Work Style & Expectations

This role operates in a fast-paced agency environment where priorities move quickly, and multiple projects run simultaneously. You will be expected to:

Proactively follow up and drive work forward, rather than wait for direction





Ask clarifying questions when needed, then take ownership of execution (thinking two steps ahead to achieve a lasting, long-term solution, not a band-aid fix) 





Manage many small details across multiple accounts, without losing accuracy





Identify when something is incomplete, unclear, or broken — and help resolve it fast





Keep systems, documentation, and workflows clean and up to date as part of daily work





Success in this role comes from being organized, responsive, and persistent in ensuring tasks are truly finished — not just started.



Core Responsibilities

1. Delivery Coordination & Execution Support

Assist with Meta Ads campaign setup, updates, launches, and QA





Ensure campaigns follow internal structure, naming conventions, and tracking standards





Build and maintain workflows, triggers, forms, and integrations inside GoHighLevel (GHL)





Maintain and verify attribution tracking inside Cometly, ensuring accounts remain properly connected and data is syncing





Configure and prepare client systems during onboarding





Troubleshoot automation, CRM, and integration issues





Coordinate relaunches, approvals, and platform resubmissions when required







2. Project Management & Workflow Control (ClickUp)

Maintain accurate task tracking, timelines, and statuses





Translate direction into clear, actionable tasks for specialists





Assign and coordinate work across technical, creative, and support teams





Follow up to ensure deliverables are completed fully and on time





Ensure tasks are validated — not just marked complete





Maintain clean documentation, SOPs, and project organization







3. Quality Assurance & Execution Verification

QA campaigns, workflows, builds, and integrations before and after launch (requires extremely high attention to detail so errors are caught before going live)  





Test automations, lead routing, and tracking to confirm functionality





Confirm work is fully resolved before closing tasks





Perform routine operational checks to ensure nothing is stuck or incomplete







4. Systems & Platform Administration

Manage user access across platforms (GHL, Meta, ClickUp, Google, Cometly, etc.)





Maintain integrations and ensure attribution tracking remains functional





Coordinate onboarding/offboarding of clients and tea
mbers inside systems





Keep records of permissions, logins, and configurations organized







5. Operational Tracking & Reporting Support

Maintain internal trackers, dashboards, and reporting spreadsheets





Create simple trackers when visibility into workflow or KPIs is needed





Keep operational and financial tracking sheets updated using provided data (non-accounting)





Ensure leadership has clear, accurate operational visibility







6. Administrative & Communication Coordination

Monitor shared inboxes and route messages appropriately





Surface time-sensitive issues and ensure follow-up





Coordinate contractor setup and payments via Wise (non-accounting logistics)





Coordinate with the company’s bookkeeper and CPA by gathering requested information, answering operational questions, and helping ensure documents are provided for monthly bookkeeping and tax preparation 





Support day-to-day internal communication across the team







7. Process Improvement (Execution-Level)

Identify workflow inefficiencies and recommend practical improvements





Refine ClickUp templates, SOPs, and handoffs based on real usage





Document repeatable processes and maintain change logs when systems evolve





Implement approved updates within existing tools and workflows





This role improves execution inside existing systems — not company strategy or organizational design.



Required Skills & Experience

Strong hands-on experience with Meta Ads Manager





Direct working experience inside GoHighLevel (GHL)





Advanced familiarity with ClickUp or similar project management tools





Experience maintaining workflows, SOPs, and operational systems





Ability to review and QA work completed by other tea
mbers





Highly detail-oriented with strong follow-through





Comfortable working during U.S. Central Time business hours





Strong written English communication





Able to manage multiple moving projects with accuracy and efficiency





Able to turn loose direction into structured tasks, documentation, or workflows





Comfortable working in a deadline-driven environment with frequent context-switching







What We’re Looking For

Someone with extremely high attention to detail 





Someone obsessed with accuracy, who does not rush, skip steps, or do sloppy work 





Someone who enjoys execution, organization, and making systems run smoothly





A proactive problem-solver who drives tasks to completion without being chased





Comfortable coordinating across multiple specialists





Naturally closes loops and ensures nothing falls through the cracks





Reliable, consistent, and interested in a long-term role





A systems-minded executor — not a strategist or department owner







What This Role Is Not

Not a marketing strategist role — you will not be responsible for developing campaign strategy, writing core messaging, or making optimization decisions. Those are handled by our marketing leads and specialists.





Not a leadership or people-management position — you will coordinate work, but you will not conduct employee reviews, hire/fire, or be responsible for any one department’s performance.





Not responsible for company-level or client-level decision-making — your role is to implement, verify, and support execution based on defined direction.





Not an accounting or bookkeeping role — you may help coordinate payments and maintain trackers, but you will not perform bookkeeper-level financial reporting, reconciliation, or do accounting work.





Not a build-from-scratch systems architect role — you will help improve and maintain existing processes but won’t be expected to design entirely new operational structures on your own.





Not responsible for performing accounting work, preparing financial statements, or filing taxes — you will help facilitate communication and documentation with our bookkeeper and CPA.

This is a hands-on coordination and execution role focused on accuracy, follow-through, and operational consistency — ensuring that plans are carried out correctly and systems continue to run reliably regardless of who is executing them.



Why This Role Matters

This position ensures our specialists can focus on their expertise while execution stays organized, systems remain clean, and clients receive consistent delivery.

If you enjoy structured work, improving processes, and keeping complex operations moving, this role is a strong fit.





How to apply:

Send us your resume with a 1-3 minute Loom video explaining why you’re a great fit for this role. 

Put “Ricky Bobby” in the subject line.

title: Part-Time Social Media Engagement Specialist
description:
We are looking for a compassionate and emotionally intelligent Social Media Engagement Specialist to join our team at SOBERSYNQ, an AI-powered recovery ecosystem designed to support people on their sobriety journey.



This role focuses on engaging with our online community — responding to comments, DMs, and posts from individuals who are navigating recovery, cravings, relapse, and personal growth.



Position Details:

• Rate: $2.50/hour

• Hours: 20 hours per week

• Remote position

• Long-term opportunity



Your Responsibilities:

• Respond to community members with empathy, encouragement, and respect

• Engage in meaningful conversations around sobriety and recovery

• Support individuals who may be struggling with cravings or relapse

• Maintain a non-judgmental, calm, and compassionate tone

• Encourage community members to download and actively use the SOBERSYNQ app as a daily recovery companion

• Help users understand how SOBERSYNQ can support different areas of their life — emotional support, 12-step guidance, tracking patterns, and staying accountable



We are looking for someone who:

• Has excellent written English

• Is emotionally mature and stable

• Can respond thoughtfully in sensitive or high-emotion situations

• Understands boundaries (we support — we do not diagnose or give medical advice)

• Is reliable and consistent

• Has experience in community management (preferred but not required)



This role is important. Many of the people you will speak to may be vulnerable or at risk of relapse. Your words matter.



TEST TASK (Required)



Please write how you would respond to each of the following messages:



1. “I’ve been sober for 6 months but today I really want to use again. I’m tired of fighting this.”



2. “I already drank after being clean for 3 months. I feel like a failure.”



3. “Nothing is working. I don’t think sobriety is worth it anymore.”



We are looking for responses that show empathy, emotional intelligence, encouragement, and healthy boundaries. Do not sound robotic or scripted. Speak like a real human who truly cares.



To apply, please:

• Send your resume

• Include your test task responses

• Tell us why you believe you’re a good fit for this role

• Write “SOBERSYNQ Support” in the subject line

   - Source products based on specs, budget, and goals

   - Coordinate samples and track timelines

Work setup & hours:

To apply, include:

title: Telemarketing Sales/Outbound Marketing
description:
Job Title: Outbound Marketing Lead (US and Canadian Clients – Remote, EST Hours)

Location: Remote (US/Canada)

Time Zone: Must be available to work full or partial overlap with North American (EST) hours

Company: roister.ai, based in Vancouver, Canada



About roister

roister is a Canadian-based company that primarily sells its sales automation and lead generation solutions to the US market. The company combines human expertise with intelligent automation through its AI Data Agents and AI Messaging Agents to deliver personalized, high-performing multi-channel outreach campaigns across
, LinkedIn, and telemarketing. As roister expands, we are seeking an Outbound Marketing Lead based in India to manage outbound campaigns for our North American clients, ensuring consistent execution and client satisfaction.



Role Overview

Prior experience in client-facing roles with US or Canadian clients is critical. The Telemarketing Lead will own day-to-day execution of outbound phone-based lead generation campaigns for roister clients across the US and Canada. This role focuses on converting warm and cold prospects into qualified conversations and booked meetings through structured calling, follow-ups, and tight feedback loops with internal teams.



This is a hands-on, execution-focused role that requires confidence on the phone, strong qualification skills, and the ability to operate within U.S. EST hours while collaborating with roister’s strategy and delivery teams.



Key Responsibilities

- Execute telemarketing campaigns targeting warm, semi-warm, and cold B2B leads to generate qualified meetings

- Call into leads generated from
, LinkedIn, inbound inquiries, dormant CRM lists, and data-enriched prospect lists

- Qualify prospects in real time against client ICPs and buying signals

- Book meetings directly onto client calendars and ensure proper handoff and context

- Follow up with interested leads via phone and light
/SMS where appropriate to increase show-up rates

- Maintain accurate call notes, dispositions, and outcomes in the CRM

- Provide feedback to internal teams on call objections, ICP fit, messaging gaps, and lead quality

- Work closely with roister’s strategy and data teams to refine call scripts, talk tracks, and targeting

- Track and report on key telemarketing metrics including dials, conversations, meetings booked, and show-up rates

- Support onboarding of new clients by understanding their ICP, value proposition, and qualification criteria





Compensation

Competitive monthly compensation based on experience, with performance-based incentives. This is a full-time contractor position based in Philippines. Prior experience in client-facing roles with US or Canadian clients

title: Leasing Assistant
description:
Join our Leasing Assistant Team! We are committed to exceeding expectations through exceptional service, strong operational support, and a collaborative, professional work environment.



Job Description/Responsibilities

Monitor the CRM daily to identify and respond to new leasing leads in a timely manner.

Review incoming leads and determine the most effective outreach method to establish initial contact.

Prequalify prospective residents and actively engage them to generate interest in available properties.

Recommend alternative managed properties when prospects are not interested in the originally inquired property.

Coordinate with onsite leasing agents and property managers to schedule apartment showings based on availability.

Accurately document all lead interactions, communications, and notes in the CRM for onsite team reference.

Review and track onsite leasing agents’ feedback and notes following apartment showings.

Conduct follow-up communication with prospects after showings to advance the leasing process.

Guide and support the lead throughout the lease application process to ensure a smooth experience.

Once leases are signed and payments are received, coordinate with prospects and property managers to schedule move-in dates.

Prepare and generate basic reports on lead activity, leasing performance, and key metrics.

Regularly audit third-party listing platforms to ensure all available units are accurately listed.

Maintain up-to-date listings by ensuring accurate photos, pricing, availability, and property descriptions.



Tools Used:



Yardi



Microsoft Office Products



Job Requirements:

2-3 years of leasing, real estate, or related experience

Experience using CRM systems (Yardi preferred)

Strong communication and follow-up skills

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Ability to manage multiple leads efficiently



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a brief summary of your relevant experience through OLJ messaging only.

title: Virtual Assistant (Part-time, 20 hours/week)
description:
About Us



ES1M is a growing tech startup building a mobile-first platform in the telecom space. We're making mobile data simple, affordable, and sustainable for travelers and remote professionals worldwide.



We’re hiring a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support us with content preparation, internal documentation, and recruitment coordination. Our website is built in React (not a traditional CMS), so your job is to prepare content in a clean, consistent format (Google Docs), not to publish code or work in the repo.



Hours: Part-time, approx. 20 hours/week

Working window: Flexible, but must be within 08:00–17:00 CET

Location: Remote

Start: ASAP / flexible



What you’ll do

1) Website content preparation (React site, no CMS yet)



Create and maintain country pages for all supported destinations (SEO-focused) using a template we provide

Prepare blog posts and website copy in Google Docs (consistent structure, headings, links, clarity)

Use checklists to ensure content is “publish-ready” for our team (formatting consistency, internal linking suggestions, missing info flagged)





2) Internal documentation (Wiki.js, SOPs, FAQs)



Expand and organize our Wiki.js (structure, categories, naming, internal links)

Turn explanations we give (notes, Loom videos, Slack messages) into clear SOPs in Google Docs and/or Wiki.js

Create and maintain FAQs and internal “how-to” docs

Keep documentation updated as processes change





3) Recruitment support



Help post roles, track applicants, and maintain a simple hiring pipeline (Google Sheets)

Shortlist candidates using criteria we provide

Coordinate interview scheduling and follow-ups

Keep hiring templates and docs organized





What we’re looking for



Strong written English (clear, structured, professional)

Very organized and proactive with follow-ups

Comfortable working in Google Docs/Sheets and keeping things tidy

Able to turn rough input into polished docs quickly

Reliable availability within 08:00–17:00 CET

Bonus: experience with Wiki.js or maintaining internal wikis





How to apply

Send:



A short intro (why you’re a fit)

Your availability within 08:00–17:00 CET

) is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu

mbers, including a thriving remote team.

nts (not just website maintenance).

-Strong project management experience in e-commerce, coordinating multiple stakeholders to deliver time-sensitive launches.

.

title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist (In-House Recruiter)
description:
Ikigai Cases is hiring for a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist

Location: Remote

Compensation: $1800 per month + performance-based bonuses



About the Company

Ikigai Cases is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu
tal pill cases. The business was founded in 2021 in Washington DC by two brothers. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



What We’re Looking For

We’re hiring a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist who is a true hunter—someone exceptional at cold sourcing senior talent and uncovering high-caliber Manager, Director, and Executive candidates from the market. You’ll work hand-in-hand with the Recruiting Manager and the CEO, executing tightly defined searches based on clear job descriptions and ICPs, then independently sourcing, qualifying, and delivering top-tier candidates. This is not a generalist recruiting or HR role. We’re looking for a self-sufficient candidate sourcing professional who can design search strategies, find talent others miss, and consistently surface candidates worth executive time with minimal direction.



About You

-You should be self-motivated and looking to work hard - as you will be expected to work hard, contribute and execute without supervision to help the whole team.

-You are highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities without sacrificing quality.

-You take pride in your work and are proactive, anticipating the needs of the company and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



5 Core Responsibilities

1. EXECUTIVE-LEVEL COLD SOURCING: Independently identify and source high-caliber Manager, Director, and Executive candidates using LinkedIn, networks, and non-obvious channels—based on a clearly defined job description and ideal candidate profile.

2. SEARCH STRATEGY & MARKET INTELLIGENCE: Design and execute end-to-end sourcing strategies per role, including identifying where top candidates actually work, how they move roles, and which backgrounds consistently produce A-players.

3. OUTREACH & FIRST-CONTACT QUALIFICATION: Write high-signal cold outreach that converts strong candidates into conversations, then conduct initial screens to validate role fit, caliber, and motivation before handing off to the lead interviewer.

4. PIPELINE OWNERSHIP (SOURCING STAGE): Build and maintain a clean, organized top-of-funnel pipeline of sourced candidates—tracking outreach, responses, and qualified handoffs with speed and precision.

5. SCREENING INTERVIEWS: Run short, high-signal screening interviews for select Manager, Director, or Executive candidates when additional clarity is required—confirming scope, decision-making level, and trajectory before handing off candidates to leadership.



Why You Should Take This Role

-You’ll be working at a brand that is obsessed with their customers and has built a loyal following. Just read a few of their reviews:

-You’ll be working at a company that has scaled up extremely quickly - while focusing on the operational side of the business. Now that the operations are stabilized with key roles in place, we are focused on investing in growth.

-You’ll be working hand-in-hand with the founders of the company - building the systems and growth strategy together.

-You’ll be working at a company with a robust product development roadmap that includes new colors / products releasing monthly



Required Experience & Skills Experience:

-Minimum of 3 years in talent acquisition, recruiting & headhunting roles, including experience searching for e-commerce talent specifically

-Proven ability to source great candidates, evaluate them, coordinate the interview process with the client, and close searches effectively and independently.

-Excellent English skills & an outgoing personality as you will be required to represent the brand to prospective candidates during screening interviews and in written messages to candidates



Communication & English Proficiency

-Excellent written and verbal English skills.

-Excellent energy & interview presence to engage candidates with the company.

-Ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and candidates over



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $1,800 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Hours: 50 hours per week, Monday through Friday. The hours are 8AM to 6PM EST.

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

You’ll work hand-in-hand with the Recruiting Manager and the CEO, executing tightly defined searches based on clear job descriptions and ICPs, then independently sourcing, qualifying, and delivering top-tier candidates. We’re looking for a self-sufficient candidate sourcing professional who can design search strategies, find talent others miss, and consistently surface candidates worth executive time with minimal direction.

3. OUTREACH & FIRST-CONTACT QUALIFICATION: Write high-signal cold outreach that converts strong candidates into conversations, then conduct initial screens to validate role fit, caliber, and motivation before handing off to the lead interviewer.

4. PIPELINE OWNERSHIP (SOURCING STAGE): Build and maintain a clean, organized top-of-funnel pipeline of sourced candidates—tracking outreach, responses, and qualified handoffs with speed and precision.

5. SCREENING INTERVIEWS: Run short, high-signal screening interviews for select Manager, Director, or Executive candidates when additional clarity is required—confirming scope, decision-making level, and trajectory before handing off candidates to leadership. 



Why You Should Take This Role

title: Supply Chain Director
description:
Ikigai Cases is hiring for a Director of Supply Chain

Location: Remote

Compensation: $3500 per month + performance-based bonuses



About the Company

Ikigai Cases (
) is a fast-growing ecommerce brand manufacturing aerospace-grade aluminum pill cases. Founded in December 2021 by two brothers after their father's neurological diagnosis led them to discovering the issues with plastic pill organizers, we've built a multi-million dollar business in just over four years with a team of 25 across the globe. 



Our mission is simple: make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We deliver on this by managing in-house fulfillment at our Washington, DC facility (including custom engraving) and maintaining obsessive attention to detail.



About the Role

We are hiring a Director of Supply Chain to take complete ownership of our supply chain function — strategy, execution, team development, and results. If you've scaled ecommerce/DTC supply chains before and want full autonomy to run a supply chain like your own business unit, this is the role.



You'll inherit a solid operational foundation including a capable team of two (Supply Chain Manager and Demand Planner), and your mandate is to turn supply chain operations at Ikigai Cases into a well-oiled machine. We expect you to come into the company and systematically reduce costs, build scalable systems, and eliminate fires before they reach leadership.

This is a role where you're expected to bring your own vision, not execute someone else's — you'll diagnose what needs to happen, build the roadmap, and drive measurable improvements every quarter without needing direction.



5 Core Responsibilities

Supply Chain Strategy & Execution Ownership: Own the supply chain function end-to-end with complete strategic and operational accountability. Build the roadmap from current state to future scale, execute autonomously, and deliver quarterly results without needing direction or validation.



Proactive Problem Resolution & Crisis Management: Eliminate supply chain fires before they reach leadership—vendor delays, tariff chaos, customs nightmares, stockout risks. Handle all escalations decisively through strong vendor relationships, creative problem-solving, and systems that prevent recurring issues.



Cost Optimization & Continuous Improvement: Systematically drive down landed costs, optimize vendor terms, and improve operational efficiency quarter over quarter. Deliver measurable cost reductions and margin improvements through strategic sourcing, freight optimization, tariff mitigation strategies, and process excellence.



Supply Chain System Builder: Design and implement world-class demand planning, inventory management, vendor partnerships, and operational processes that scale seamlessly through aggressive growth. Build the infrastructure that turns chaotic firefighting into predictable, bulletproof operations.



Team Leadership & Development: Manage and significantly elevate our Supply Chain Manager and Demand Planner through coaching, systems, and clear accountability. Take full ownership of their performance and growth, scale the team strategically as needed, hire A-players, and maintain consistently high standards across all supply chain operations.



Why You Should Take This Role

-You’ll be working at a brand that is obsessed with their customers and has built a loyal following. Just read a few of their reviews: 

-You'll be working at a company that has scaled rapidly in just 4 years and is aggressively investing in growth. Our goal is to make the best pill cases in the world.

-You’ll be working with people who have extreme levels of competitive fire in their bellies - people who will run through walls to make sure the company succeeds.

-You'll work hand-in-hand with the founder, not through layers of management, with full autonomy to own your domain.

-You’ll be working to make people’s lives easier with products they’ll use every single day. The company was founded to solve a personal problem Tavish’s father had with his pill organizers while battling a neurological condition for a decade. 

-You’ll be working on a complex, truly unique supply chain - aerospace-grade aluminum manufacturing, in-house engraving, international freight, tariff strategy, high-velocity product releases. 



Required Experience & Skills Experience

-7+ years of total supply chain experience in DTC/ecommerce brands

-3+ years as a Director of Supply Chain (or equivalent leadership role with full functional ownership)

-Hard goods manufacturing experience (metal, durability products, consumer goods - NOT apparel/soft goods only)

-International manufacturing management (Asia-US supply chains)

-Proven measurable cost reduction achievements

-Has managed supply chain teams (3+ people)

-Has navigated major supply chain crises (tariffs, COVID, vendor failures)

-Must be based outside the United States.



Nice-to-Have Experience

-CNC Machining / Aerospace-Grade Aluminum / Anodizing supply chain experience

-Experience with in-house fulfillment operations (not just outsourced 3PL)

-EOS (Entrepreneurial Operating System) familiarity

-High-velocity product launch experience (monthly or faster launch cadence)

-Multi-country sourcing experience (supplier diversification strategies)

-Multi-channel fulfillment experience (DTC, Amazon, wholesale/retail)



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $3500 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Hours: 50 hours per week, flexible scheduling to meet needs of the role

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

-PTO: 1 week earned for every 6 months worked at the company

-Location: Remote / Work From Home



To Apply

Fill out the application form here: 



This application includes a number of questions in order to ensure we hire an outstanding candidate for this position, so please be advised in advance that it will take time to complete.



Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. Qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. Applications on OnlineJobs.ph, DMs, and messages sent via
 will not be reviewed.

description:

title: Short-Form Video Editor (AI + Cinematic Educational Content)
description:

We are hiring a highly skilled short-form video editor to produce cinematic, high-retention videos for social media.



This is not basic editing.



We create serious, authority-driven educational content (medical/dental niche) using AI-generated visuals, subtle animation, and professional pacing. The goal is to make viewers stop scrolling and feel like they’re watching a Netflix-style mini documentary — in under 60 seconds.



If you only know how to add captions and background music, this is not for you.



What You’ll Be Doing



Turning scripts into visually compelling 30–60 second vertical videos



Generating high-quality AI images (Midjourney or similar)



Animating images into realistic motion (Runway or similar tools)



Creating subtle, professional motion (no cheap effects)



Adding clean captions and cinematic pacing



Light sound design to enhance emotion and tension



Delivering polished, social-ready exports



You must understand pacing, tension, and visual storytelling not just transitions.



Required Skills



Strong experience editing short-form content (Reels / Shorts / TikTok)



Experience using AI tools (Runway, Pika, Midjourney, eleven labs, etc.)



Ability to create realistic animation from still images



Clean typography and caption design



Great English comprehension (you will be working from scripts)



Strong attention to detail



Ability to follow direction precisely



Bonus:

Background in cinematic or documentary-style editing



What We Value



Fast communication



Reliability



Ability to meet deadlines



Zero drama



Takes feedback well



Thinks like a professional, not a freelancer just “trying to finish the task”



Work Details

Per-video or monthly rate (to be discussed)



Long-term opportunity for the right person

title: SEO & Digital Authority Specialist (Google & YouTube Rankings

Our goal is to achieve sustainable, policy-compliant high rankings, strengthen brand authority, and improve eligibility for enhanced search features such as rich results and Google Knowledge Panels.

Key Responsibilities

1. SEO Strategy & Execution (Google)

Develop and implement comprehensive on-page and technical SEO strategies

Conduct keyword research aligned with brand positioning and audience intent

Optimize site architecture, internal linking, and content structure

Improve Core Web Vitals and overall site performance

Implement schema markup (Person, Organization, Article, etc.)

Monitor rankings, crawl errors, and search console performance

2. YouTube SEO & Video Optimization

Optimize titles, descriptions, tags, and metadata

Develop keyword-driven content strategies for YouTube search

Improve watch time, CTR, and audience retention metrics

Analyze YouTube analytics and competitor performance

Conduct digital PR outreach to reputable publications

Secure earned media placements through legitimate pitching

Build relationships with journalists, editors, and media outlets

Disavow toxic or spam links when necessary

4. Online Entity & Knowledge Panel Optimization

Ensure NAP (Name, Address, Phone) consistency where applicable

Optimize structured data for enhanced search features

Build authoritative citations and verified profiles

Improve eligibility for Google Knowledge Panel visibility through credible coverage and data consistency

Qualifications

3+ years of advanced SEO experience

Demonstrated success ranking competitive keywords on Google

Experience with tools like Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, GSC, GA4

Knowledge of structured data and schema implementation

Experience with digital PR campaigns and editorial outreach

Familiarity with YouTube ranking algorithms
