title: Lead Research Virtual Assistant (Branding & Creative Industry)
description:
Hi — I’m Anya, founder of a branding and production company focused on culture, storytelling, and community-driven work.



I’m looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help me research and find real, high-quality leads — not scraped lists, not mass outreach.



This role is about discernment and alignment, not speed.



You’ll be helping identify founders, creators, brands, and organizations that genuinely align with our values and services.



Your Main Responsibilities



Research and identify qualified leads (brands, founders, creatives, organizations)



Use platforms like:



Google



Instagram



LinkedIn



Websites / directories



Review bios, websites, and content to assess fit and intent



Log leads accurately in a Google Sheet or CRM with:



Name



Website



Social links



Contact info (if available)



Short notes on why they’re a good fit



What Makes a Lead “Qualified”



Actively building something (brand, business, project, organization)



Likely to value branding, storytelling, or production



Not huge corporations



Not spam accounts



Not random or unrelated industries



Quality matters more than quantity.



What I’m Looking For



Strong English comprehension



Excellent research skills



Attention to detail



Ability to think critically (not just copy/paste)



Experience with lead research or prospecting is a plus



Comfortable following clear criteria and guidelines



This Is NOT For You If



You rely on scraping tools only



You prioritize speed over accuracy



You don’t read instructions carefully



You submit low-effort or irrelevant leads



To Apply (Important)



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Any experience with lead research or online research



A brief explanation of how you would find high-quality leads (in your own words)



Applications without thoughtful responses will not be considered.



Why This Role Is Different



This is not generic VA work.

You’ll be contributing directly to meaningful, creative, and community-focused projects, with the opportunity to grow into a longer-term role if we work well together.

title: Video Editor – Medical & Chiropractic Ads (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
About the Role:



We’re hiring a highly organized, detail-oriented Video Editor to join our growing team.

We create simple, clear, trust-building ads for medical and chiropractic clinics. Our style is clean, professional, and clinical — not flashy, not trendy, not entertainment-driven.



This role is for someone who:



Follows instructions precisely

Is extremely organized

Understands that simple converts

Knows proper export settings and industry best practices

Can deliver consistent, polished work every time



If you prefer flashy transitions, heavy effects, or viral-style edits, this is not the right fit.



What You’ll Do:



Perform clean cuts and pacing adjustments

Edit talking-head and testimonial ads

Apply natural, professional color correction

Perform dialogue-focused audio enhancement (noise removal, leveling, clarity)

Add accurate captions/subtitles in excellent English

Create 3–4 properly formatted placement versions per ad (Meta + YouTube)

Organize files clearly inside Google Drive

Follow structured scripts and timestamps precisely

Make judgment calls that align with our brand style

Communicate clearly and proactively with our team



You must understand:



Proper export settings for Meta and YouTube ads

Bitrate control and compression best practices

Correct aspect ratios (1:1, 4:5, 9:16, 16:9)

Clean audio levels for ad platforms

File naming and organized delivery structure



We want clean, properly exported final files — not random presets.



Our Editing Style (Important):



95% no background music

No flashy zooms or trendy transitions

No distracting graphics

Subtitle/Caption Text Overlays

Professional, calm pacing

Slightly clinical / serious tone

Most ads are testimonial or doctor explanation videos.



Clarity and credibility > creativity.



Requirements:



1–2 years professional editing experience

Must be available 9am–5pm American Central Time

Excellent written English (for captions/subtitles)

Strong attention to detail

Highly organized

Experience with Adobe Premiere Pro (preferred) or similar professional software

Comfortable exporting multiple ad placements

Experience organizing projects in Google Drive

Reliable internet connection and capable editing computer



Preferred Experience:



Experience editing ads (Meta / YouTube)

Experience with testimonial or talking-head content

Experience in healthcare or professional services is a bonus



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:



Stable, full-time role (40 hours/week)

Remote work

Clear systems and structured workflows

Long-term growth opportunities

We value accountability, consistency, and long-term partnerships

Opportunity to grow as the company expands



We are building something long-term. We are not looking for short-term freelancers juggling many clients. We want someone committed and consistent.

Include the current temperature in New York City in the title of your application.

title: Research Assistant/Data Entry
description:
About Us

The Women's AI Visibility Institute (WAVI) is a U.S.-based research organization that conducts groundbreaking studies on AI visibility bias affecting women professionals. We analyze how AI platforms like ChatGPT and Gemini surface — or fail to surface — professional women, using a proprietary 20-Point AI Visibility Framework. Our research drives real change for professionals who want to be seen, cited, and recommended by AI systems.



We are expanding rapidly and publishing monthly state-by-state AI Visibility Reports across the United States. We need sharp, detail-oriented research assistants to support our growing data pipeline.



Role Overview

You will support our research team by collecting, entering, and organizing data on attorneys and other professionals as part of our AI Visibility Report production process. This is a high-volume, detail-focused role ideal for someone who is systematic, accurate, and comfortable working independently.



Key Responsibilities



Research attorneys and professionals using online directories, state bar websites, LinkedIn, and other public sources

Collect and enter structured data including names, contact information, website URLs, practice areas, and firm details into spreadsheets or designated databases



Run standardized AI platform queries (ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.) and accurately record responses following our documented protocols



Flag data inconsistencies, missing information, or anomalies for review

Maintain organized file and data records in Google Sheets and Google Drive

Meet daily and weekly data entry targets with a high degree of accuracy





Requirements



Strong English reading and writing comprehension

Excellent attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy

Proficiency in Google Sheets and/or Microsoft Excel

Comfortable using AI tools such as ChatGPT and Google Gemini

Ability to follow detailed written protocols and standard operating procedures

Reliable internet connection and computer

Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines



Nice to Have



Experience with legal industry directories or legal research

Familiarity with schema markup, SEO, or digital marketing concepts

Prior experience in market research or data collection roles





Compensation



Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)

Performance bonuses available for accuracy and output targets

Consistent, ongoing project work with growth potential as we expand to all 50 U.S. states

Speedy Mobile RV Repair is the premier mobile RV repair company in Florida offering comprehensive RV care, maintenance, and repair services. Locally owned and operated, we are RVTI-accredited and insured to perform anything from routine RV checkups to repair services.



Job Overview

The Service Call Dispatcher / Parts & Service Manager, ensuring efficient dispatching, accurate parts sourcing, timely scheduling, and quality-controlled service execution. title: Lead Blockchain Developer (Smart Contracts|Remote)
description:
Company Overview



Hard Fork Distillery is pioneering the intersection of traditional whiskey craftsmanship and

blockchain governance. We're building a first-of-its-kind platform on Stacks blockchain that

enables token holders to participate in real whiskey barrel management decisions through

decentralized governance, secured by Bitcoin.



Role Overview

We're seeking an experienced blockchain developer to architect and build our core smart contract

infrastructure from the ground up. As our first technical hire, you'll be the technical authority

responsible for translating our governance vision into secure, auditable smart contracts on the

Stacks blockchain using Clarity.



Location: Remote

Reports to: Founder/CEO

Compensation: Salary + equity/token allocation

Timeline: Immediate hire for 6-month initial contract with strong potential for full-time

conversion



Core Responsibilities

Smart Contract Architecture & Development (60%)

• Design and implement governance token contracts using SIP-010 standards

• Build barrel NFT system with metadata for tracking and provenance

• Develop DAO voting mechanisms for barrel disposition decisions

• Create treasury management contracts for token holder rewards

• Implement batch-based production workflows mirroring distillery operations

• Ensure Bitcoin settlement integration through Stacks Proof of Transfer



Security & Quality Assurance (20%)

• Write comprehensive test suites for all smart contract functionality

• Collaborate with Smart Contract Auditor (hired Month 2) to address security findings

• Implement best practices for upgradeability and emergency procedures

• Document security assumptions and trust boundaries



Integration & Deployment (15%)

• Prepare contracts for DEX integration (ALEX platform)

• Coordinate testnet and mainnet deployment sequences

• Build developer tools and scripts for contract interaction

• Support front-end integration needs (when UI development begins)



Documentation & Knowledge Transfer (5%)

• Create technical documentation for audit and community review

• Mentor Junior Blockchain Developer (hired Month 2-3)

• Provide regular progress updates to CEO and Community Manager

• Document architectural decisions and rationale



Required Qualifications

Technical Skills

• 3+ years professional blockchain development experience

• Deep understanding of smart contract security principles and common vulnerabilities

• Strong programming fundamentals (any language; Clarity can be learned)

• Experience with token standards (ERC-20/721 or equivalent)

• Understanding of DAO governance mechanisms and voting systems

• Git proficiency and collaborative development practices



Blockchain-Specific

• Experience with at least one of: Stacks/Clarity, Ethereum/Solidity, or other smart

contract platforms

• Understanding of UTXO vs account-based blockchain models

• Familiarity with Bitcoin and Proof of Work principles (Stacks/Bitcoin experience

strongly preferred)

• Knowledge of decentralized exchange mechanics



Professional

• Self-directed with ability to work independently in early-stage startup environment

• Strong written communication skills for technical documentation

• Comfortable with ambiguity and rapid iteration

• Experience working with non-technical stakeholders



Preferred Qualifications

• Prior experience with Stacks blockchain and Clarity language

• Background in DeFi or DAO projects

• Experience with audit processes and security reviews

• Contribution to open-source blockchain projects

• Understanding of distillery operations or supply chain tracking (nice to have)



Success Metrics - First 6 Months

Month 1

• Complete Stacks/Clarity environment setup and tooling

• Architecture design document approved

• Initial governance token contract (testnet deployment)



Month 2

• Barrel NFT contract complete (testnet)

• Basic voting mechanism implemented

• First round of internal testing complete

• Smart Contract Auditor onboarded with preliminary code review



Month 3

• Treasury and reward distribution contracts complete

• Integration test suite passing

• Junior Developer hired and initial onboarding complete

• Community Manager has technical documentation for pre-sale materials



Month 4

• All major security audit findings addressed

• DEX integration specifications complete

• Testnet deployment fully functional with all features



Month 5

• Final audit approval received

• Mainnet deployment preparation complete

• Junior Developer contributing independently to codebase



Month 6

• Mainnet deployment successful

• Token trading live on DEX

• First governance vote executed on-chain

• Documentation complete for ongoing development



Why Join Hard Fork Distillery?

• Ground-floor opportunity to build a novel blockchain application with real-world utility

• Work on genuinely innovative use case combining traditional industry with Web3

• Backed by Arctic Systems (Bitcoin mining equipment) providing stability and resources

• Backed by Tekna Fill (Contract Bottling)

• Significant autonomy and technical decision-making authority

• Equity/token participation in platform success

• Remote-first culture with focus on outcomes over hours



About Our Technology Stack

We're building on Stacks blockchain, which brings smart contract capabilities to Bitcoin through

Proof of Transfer consensus. Our platform will manage real whiskey barrel inventory through

on-chain governance, creating a unique bridge between traditional distillery operations and

decentralized decision-making. This represents a genuine utility application of blockchain

technology with tangible real-world assets.



Application Process

Please submit your resume along with:

• Portfolio of smart contract work (GitHub links preferred)

• Brief explanation of your interest in this specific project

• Any questions about the role or platform architecture



We're particularly interested in developers who are excited about building something genuinely

novel in the blockchain space—not just another DeFi clone, but a platform that brings

blockchain governance to a traditional industry in a meaningful way.

title: Dropshipping Product Research
description:
Product Researcher for Dropshipping Stores (Long-Term Role)



We are looking for an experienced Product Researcher to join our growing e-commerce team.

This role is 100% focused on product research for dropshipping stores. The goal is to fully outsource research and build a consistent flow of winning products, based on current and upcoming trends.

If you have proven experience researching products for dropshipping stores and understand how to validate demand using data — this role is for you.





Your Responsibilities



As our Product Researcher, you will be responsible for finding high-potential products using multiple proven research methods, including:



Competitor research (successful dropshipping stores & ads)

Google Trends analysis (identifying rising and seasonal trends)

Meta Ads Library research (analyzing active and scaling ads)

Cross-checking product demand and trend sustainability

Organizing findings clearly for handover to the team





You will work closely with:



Product listers

Supply chain managers

The store owner (strategy & direction)

Your research should allow the team to act fast and launch products with confidence.



Requirements (Must-Have)



Proven experience with dropshipping product research

Experience researching products for active dropshipping stores



Strong understanding of:



What makes a product “sellable”

Trend-based product validation

Ability to work independently and deliver structured research



Good communication skills in English



Nice to Have (Big Plus)



Experience with Google Ads for dropshipping



Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills



Experience working in an e-commerce team (research,  listing,  sourcing)







What Success Looks Like in This Role



A constant flow of new product ideas



Products aligned with current and upcoming trends



Clear, structured research that the team can immediately use



Minimal supervision needed once onboarding is complete



The goal is long-term collaboration where product research is fully handled by you.





Position Details



Remote / Work from home



Part-time or full-time (to be discussed)



Long-term position



Competitive salary based on experience

title: Cold Caller (B2B & B2C) – Work From Home
description:

title: Meta Ad Creative Specialist – Performance Obsessed, AI-Native
description:
This role isn't for most creatives. Read carefully.

We're hiring one person to own Meta ad creative across our portfolio of businesses. Not a team. One person who can do what most agencies need five people for.

You'll be responsible for every static, video, and UGC-style ad we run. You'll concept, produce, iterate, and scale—fast. You'll use AI tools not as a crutch but as a multiplier. And you'll be judged on one thing: results.

The Reality of This Role



You'll produce 20-50+ ad variations per week across multiple brands

You'll go from brief to live creative in hours, not days

You'll kill your own work when the data says it's not performing

You'll operate with minimal oversight and maximum accountability



What You Must Be Able to Do



Create scroll-stopping static ads

Produce short-form video ads optimized for Reels, Stories, and Feed

Script and edit UGC-style content that feels native, not produced

Write direct response copy that converts—hooks, body, CTA

Use AI tools fluently across image generation, video production, voice, and editing

Analyze creative performance in Ads Manager and translate data into next iterations

Move fast without sacrificing quality



What Separates You From Everyone Else



You've personally created ads that have driven six figures or more in tracked revenue

You understand why an ad works, not just that it worked

You think in frameworks: problem-agitate-solve, hook-story-offer, us vs. them

You can produce founder-led style content, talking head ads, and 
-format creative

You treat AI as your production team, not a novelty

You're relentless about testing and unattached to your own ideas



Non-Negotiables



Portfolio of Meta ads with documented performance metrics (ROAS, CPA, or revenue driven)

Demonstrated proficiency with AI creative tools across multiple categories

Ability to work US business hours with fast communication

You can show us a raw creative and the five iterations you tested after it



We Don't Care About



Your degree

How many followers you have

Awards or agency pedigree

Creative that's "on brand" but doesn't sell



Compensation

Competitive base plus performance bonuses tied directly to ad results. This is a high-output role and we pay accordingly for high performers.

To Apply

Show us your best work and tell us why you're the right fit. Include performance data where possible.

title: Executive Assistant to CEO – High-Performance, Full-Scope Support
description:

You're not here to take notes. You're here to make sure nothing falls through the cracks.

 and communication management: drafting, responding, and flagging what matters

Liaising with tea
mbers to ensure deadlines are met and projects stay on track

What We're Looking For

Comfortable holding tea
mbers accountable and following up without being asked

title: Bookkeeper
description:
High Tech UK Accounting Practice, looking for a superstar bookkeeper or a someone with the potential to be a superstar bookkeeper.



Core Responsibilities:



Key day-to-day duties generally include: 



Data Entry: Accurately recording all sales, purchases, receipts, and payments into an accounting system or software.



Bank Reconciliation: Comparing internal financial records with bank statements to ensure consistency and identify discrepancies.



Accounts Payable/Receivable: Managing supplier invoices and payments (AP), and creating customer invoices, monitoring payments, and following up on overdue accounts (AR/credit control).



Financial Reporting: Preparing regular reports, such as income statements (profit and loss) and balance sheets, for business owners or managers.



VAT Returns: Preparing and submitting Value Added Tax (VAT) returns to the relevant tax authorities (e.g., HMRC in the UK).



Payroll Administration: Calculating employee wages, managing deductions, processing expense claims, and issuing P60s and P11Ds. 



Advanced and Additional Duties:



Implementing internal controls and reviewing processes to improve efficiency. 



Preparing data ready for annual accounts, Accruals/Prepayments/Data quality checking/ Preparing Preparation of Balance Sheet reconciliations



Correcting any inconsistencies to help the Accountants resolve inaccuracies



Attention to detail is very important and use of the English language to communicate in a down to earth manner.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**To apply, please upload an updated copy of your resume as well as a 2-3 minute video detailing your experience. 



Role Overview

We’re hiring an exceptional Executive Assistant to support the Chief Operating Officer of a fast-growing, multi-site services business. The COO runs the operational engine: field execution, staffing/scheduling, compliance, service quality, and cross-functional performance.

 

This role is for someone who can operate as a COO “air-traffic controller” — protecting time, closing loops, driving follow-through, and ensuring nothing critical drops across a high-volume environment.

This is not a “calendar only” role.

 

You are building leverage. You are running systems. You are the COO’s execution layer.

You will handle both professional and select personal responsibilities to reduce friction and keep the COO operating at peak effectiveness. You will be trusted with sensitive information and expected to exercise sound judgment.

 

Core Responsibilities

1) Calendar Management & Time Protection (Primary)

• Own and optimize a complex calendar across operational leadership cadence (daily/weekly/monthly).

• Schedule with intent: deep work blocks, site/branch time, leadership check-ins, buffer time, travel recovery.

• Proactively gatekeep: decline/redirect low-value meetings and clarify purpose/outcomes before booking.

• Coordinate multi-party scheduling across SLT, regional leaders, HR, finance, compliance, vendors.

• Build and maintain recurring rhythms:

o Weekly operating reviews

o KPI/scorecard meetings

o I
/escalation reviews

o Hiring/people reviews

o Site visits / branch reviews

• Maintain a rolling 2–4 week lookahead and flag conflicts early.

• Ensure every meeting has: objective, attendees, prep, agenda, materials, and next steps.

Outputs you own: weekly schedule plan, daily run-of-show, meeting cadence map.

2) Inbox Triage & Communications Command Center

• Triage COO inbox daily:

o Sort, flag, archive, respond where appropriate

o Draft replies in COO voice for approval

o Escalate only what requires COO decision

• Maintain a follow-up tracker and chase responses relentlessly.

• Coordinate responses across internal stakeholders to keep the COO out of thread chaos.

• Identify patterns in communication breakdowns and fix the system (not just the
).

• Manage sensitive/confidential communications with discretion.

Non-negotiable: nothing important goes unanswered or forgotten.

3) Follow-Ups, Action Items, and “Close-the-Loop” Execution

• Attend select meetings to capture action items, owners, deadlines (or request notes fro
eting owners and systematize).

• Maintain an operational action log:

o Decisions made

o Open items

o Due dates

o Accountability check-ins

• Proactively follow up with leaders to drive completion.

• Escalate when blockers persist and propose options, not problems.

• Ensure key commitments made by operations are documented and executed.

4) Project Coordination & Cross-Functional Ops Support

• Support COO on core operational initiatives (examples):

o Process standardization / SOP rollouts

o Onboarding improvements

o Staffing/scheduling efficiency projects

o Quality assurance and i
 tracking

o Compliance documentation workflows

o Vendor implementations (software, payroll, etc.)

• Coordinate project meetings, maintain timelines, track deliverables.

• Prepare brief status updates (1-pagers) so COO can see the whole board quickly.

• Track dependencies across HR, Finance, Compliance, Clinical, Recruiting, Scheduling.

This is coordination + pressure-testing, not “project management theater.”

5) Prep Materials, Briefing Packs & Meeting Excellence

• Create and distribute briefing packets in advance:

o KPI snapshots / dashboards (from ops analytics/CFO team)

o Agenda and desired outcomes

o Key context and risks

o Prior meeting notes and unresolved items

• Ensure the COO walks into every meeting prepared:

o correct documents

o latest numbers

o known landmines

o decision points highlighted

• Organize, version-control, and file meeting materials cleanly.

6) Travel & Logistics (White-Glove, Efficient)

• Plan and manage business travel:

o flights, hotels, car services, site visit routing

o itineraries with confirmations and contingency plans

• Build travel to maximize productivity:

o cluster meetings by geography

o add buffers for delays

o ensure time for prep and follow-ups

• Coordinate occasional personal/family travel as requested.

• Handle last-minute changes without drama.

• Maintain loyalty accounts, preferences, and travel profiles.

7) Vendor & External Stakeholder Communication

• Act as coordinator for operational vendors and partners:

o scheduling calls

o collecting proposals

o routing contracts for review/signature

o tracking deliverables and renewals

• Manage vendor communications professionally and promptly.

• Track contracts, renewal dates, and service issues.

• Ensure COO has clean decision memos: options, pricing, recommendation.

8) Personal Responsibilities (Selective, High-Impact)

To protect COO focus, this role includes targeted personal support, such as:

• Manage personal calendar integration.

• Coordinate family schedules and logistics.

• Schedule medical/dental appointments.

• Coordinate household vendors (maintenance, contractors, services).

• Manage gifting (holidays, birthdays, business relationships).

• Assist with special projects (events, trips, milestone celebrations).

• Maintain confidential personal documentation.

• Track key dates (anniversaries, deadlines, renewals).

• Ensure personal finances/admin tasks stay organized.

Scope is reasonable, but the goal is the same: eliminate friction.

Required Qualifications

• 5+ years supporting a senior executive (COO/CEO/President) in a high-tempo environment.

• Mastery of Outlook (calendar + inbox systems).

• Strong written communication and executive judgment.

• Proven ability to manage competing priorities without dropping details.

• Experience coordinating projects, deadlines, and stakeholders across departments.

• Absolute discretion with confidential information.

• Calm under pressure; high ownership; low ego.

Preferred

• Experience in healthcare services, home care, staffing-heavy businesses, multi-site operations, or regulated industries.

• Familiarity with Teams, SharePoint/OneDrive, Asana/Notion/ClickUp, CRM tools.

• Comfort working with data/KPI summaries (you don’t need to be an analyst, but you must be fluent).

Traits That Matter Here (Non-Negotiable)

• Proactive to the point of annoying (in a good way).

• Detail-obsessed but not precious.

• Fast and accurate.

• Strong backbone with tact.

• High emotional intelligence.

• Systems thinker: fixes root causes, not symptoms.

• Can handle intensity without taking it personally.

• Naturally closes loops and hates loose ends.

title: REAL ESTATE -Buyer Search & Comp Specialist for Top New York Realtor (MLS + Spreadsheet Role)
description:
If you love spreadsheets, MLS searches, Google Maps, and pulling comps — keep reading. 

Top New York Realtor looking for a Buyer Search & Comp Specialist — not a general assistant.



This role is repetitive, structured, and data-driven.

If you prefer creative marketing or big-picture strategy, this is not the role for you.



You will:



• Pull 3–7 tight comps per request

• Analyze building-specific pricing trends

• Calculate price per square foot accurately

• Compare floor lines (Floor 6 vs Floor 26 matters)

• Identify if views are blocked on lower floors

• Check avenue vs side street exposure

• Review listing photos for renovation level

• Identify PTAC vs through-wall vs window AC

• Compare common charges and tax abatements

• Deliver clean, structured reports (no fluff)



You must be comfortable using:



• MLS

• StreetEasy

• Google Maps (standard + satellite)

• Spreadsheets



This role requires:



• Extreme attention to detail

• Structured thinking

• Accuracy in calculations

• Ability to follow instructions exactly

• Availability 9AM–5PM EST



We are building infrastructure for the next 5–10 years. 

This is not a short-term or secondary job.

==========================



TO APPLY



Your FIRST LINE  must say:



I LOVE DOING BUYER SEARCHES for NEW YORK 



Include:



1- Why buyer searches genuinely interest you and why you are the perfect candidate for this role



2- A sample comp report (remove private data)



3- Confirmation this role would replace other employment if selected- and you are available for immediate hire.



We believe in offering bonuses for full time employees who deliver exceptional work consistently.

title: Job Title: Senior MQL5 / MT5 Programmer for AI?Enhanced Forex CFD EA Development
description:
About the Role

I am looking for an experienced MT5 (MQL5) developer to build a fully automated Expert Advisor that integrates AI?based decision logic with my proprietary CFD/forex trading strategy. This is a long?term collaboration for the right candidate, with the potential for ongoing upgrades, optimization, and new modules.

The EA will run on MetaTrader 5, trading CFDs and major forex pairs, and must be built with clean, modular, and well?documented code.



Key Responsibilities

- Develop a complete MT5 Expert Advisor based on my trading rules and logic.

- Integrate AI?assisted components (machine learning or rule?based AI logic) to enhance trade filtering and decision?making.

- Implement:

- Entry/exit logic

- Risk management

- Dynamic lot sizing

- Multi?timeframe analysis

- Spread/volatility filters

- News filter (optional)

- Optimize the EA for low?latency execution and high stability.

- Provide backtesting and forward?testing support.

- Ensure the EA is compatible with CFD trading conditions (variable spreads, swaps, execution types).

- Deliver clean, readable, and well?commented MQL5 code.



Required Skills & Experience

- 3+ years of professional MQL5 / MT5 EA development

- Proven experience building complex, rule?based or AI?enhanced EAs

- Strong understanding of:

- Forex & CFD market mechanics

- Order execution models

- Risk management

- Multi?timeframe logic

- Experience with:

title: Part-Time Digital Marketing Manager (AU Mortgage Broker) — Content + Paid Ads + SEO
description:
Hours: 25 hours/week (remote). Prefer 3–4 hours/day overlap with Melbourne time.

Start: ASAP

Long-term: Yes (we want someone to grow with the business)



About Us

We’re an Australian mortgage broking business growing to the next level. We already have strong referrals/repeat business and want to increase organic inbound leads and paid lead flow while building a marketing system that can scale (and eventually feed additional brokers).

Role Objective



Own day-to-day marketing execution and improvement across:



- Social content creation + posting

- Paid ads (Meta + Google)

- SEO + organic lead growth

- Weekly reporting and optimisation



This is a hands-on role. You will plan, create, publish, measure, and improve.

Key Responsibilities



1) Content creation + social media management

Build a weekly content plan and posting schedule

Turn raw footage (we will be on camera) into:

short-form videos (Reels/Shorts/TikTok style)

carousels/static posts

story content

Write captions, hooks, CTAs, and manage basic community engagement

Repurpose content across platforms for maximum output



2) Paid advertising (Meta + Google)

Build and manage campaigns end-to-end:

targeting, creatives, copy, landing page brief, conversion tracking

optimisation, A/B testing, and budget pacing

Produce weekly performance updates:

spend, CPL, cost per booked call (where tracking allows), lead quality notes

Ensure all ad accounts are owned by us (you work inside our accounts)



3) SEO + organic growth

Improve local SEO and organic lead flow:

on-page SEO (service pages, location pages, internal links, metadata)

Google Business Profile activity (posts, Q&A, photos, review velocity process)

basic technical SEO checks (indexing, Search Console issues)

Coordinate blog/topic plan that supports organic discovery and conversion



4) Tracking, reporting, and optimisation

Set up/maintain tracking (GA4, Tag Manager basics, pixels, conversion events)

Weekly KPI dashboard and action plan:

leads, booked calls (if applicable), conversion rate, channel performance

Recommend what to scale, what to stop, and what to test next

title: Hotel Sales and Revenue Maneger Remote
description:
Job description:



Overview

We are seeking a highly driven and experienced Revenue & Sales Manager to lead and optimize revenue performance across our hospitality portfolio. This is a fully remote opportunity ideal for a strategic thinker who understands modern revenue management tools, dynamic pricing, and hotel sales optimization.



We welcome applicants with global experience and a strong background working in diverse markets and time zones.



Responsibilities



Develop and execute comprehensive sales strategies to target hospitality clients across assigned territories, ensuring consistent revenue growth.

Manage existing accounts by providing exceptional customer service, identifying upselling opportunities, and maintaining long-term relationships.

Lead prospecting efforts through cold calling, lead generation activities, and networking to identify new business opportunities in the hospitality sector.

Conduct product demos and technical sales presentations tailored to client needs, highlighting features that enhance their hospitality operations.

Utilize CRM software such as Salesforce to track sales activities, monitor pipeline progress, and analyze performance metrics for continuous improvement.

Collaborate with marketing teams to create targeted campaigns that increase brand awareness and generate qualified leads.

Negotiate contracts and pricing agreements with clients while ensuring mutually beneficial terms that support company goals.

Oversee territory management by analyzing market trends, competitor activity, and customer feedback to refine sales approaches effectively.

Skills



Proven experience in outside sales, B2B sales, or technology sales within the hospitality or related industries.

Strong management skills with the ability to lead a remote sales team and coordinate multiple accounts simultaneously.

Expertise in business development strategies including lead generation, cold calling, and direct sales techniques.

Proficiency with CRM software such as Salesforce or similar platforms for managing customer relationships and tracking sales activities.

Excellent negotiation skills paired with a customer-centric approach to ensure high satisfaction levels.

Analytical mindset capable of interpreting data for territory analysis, sales forecasting, and performance evaluation.

Effective communication skills for delivering compelling product demos and conducting negotiations confidently.

Knowledge of marketing principles relevant to retail or hospitality sectors to support strategic outreach efforts. Join us as a Remote Revenue & Sales Manager if you’re passionate about driving growth in the hospitality industry through innovative sales tactics, strategic account management, and relentless pursuit of excellence!

title: Vendor Coordinator
description:
Vendor Coordinator



Charlie’s Collectible Show (CCS)

Full-Time | Monday–Friday | 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST



About Charlie’s Collectible Show

Charlie’s Collectible Show (CCS) is a pop culture and collectibles event company based in Atlanta and Houston, with Raleigh opening soon. We host anime markets, TCG conventions, retro gaming expos, artist alleys, and competitive tournaments bringing together collectors, vendors, artists, and fans of anime, gaming, and collectibles. CCS is built on community. We create spaces where fandom connects in real life.



Position Summary

The Vendor Coordinator manages vendor registration, payment tracking, communication, and event readiness across all CCS events.



This role ensures:

 • Vendors are approved correctly

 • Payments are collected on time

 • Events are not overbooked

 •  Vendors receive clear and timely communication



This is an operations role that directly impacts revenue, vendor experience, and event quality.

We are looking for someone who is organized, confident, detail-focused, and comfortable enforcing deadlines and policies when needed.



Core Responsibilities

 •  Oversee vendor registration and approvals

 •  Monitor event capacity to prevent overbooking

 •  Track vendor payments and manage invoices

 •  Maintain accurate vendor records in Notion

 •  Communicate clearly and professionally with vendors

 •  Manage vendor-related inboxes and respond on time

 •  Send event-week instructions and confirmations

 •  Support vendor map planning and table placement

 •  Keep vendor data organized and updated

 •  Help improve vendor processes and documentation



Key Traits We’re Looking For

1. Detail-Oriented

 •  You catch small mistakes before they become bigger problems.

2. Organized & Structured

 •  You can manage multiple events at the same time without losing track.

3. Comfortable with Systems

 •  You are confident using Notion to track vendor status and workflows. Experience with Square or invoicing systems is preferred.

4. Clear Communicator

 •  You write professionally and respond to vendors with clarity and confidence.

5. Punctual & Deadline-Driven

 •  You respect timelines and understand that delays affect the entire team. You complete tasks on schedule and follow through without constant reminders.

Team Player

 •  You work well with others and believe in building a stronger team together. You communicate openly, support your teammates, and contribute to improving systems so everyone can grow and operate at a higher level.



Qualifications

 •  2–5 years of experience in administrative or operations roles that require high accuracy and attention to detail (examples: law office administration, accounts receivable, billing coordination, invoicing roles)

 •  Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines

 •  Experience using project management tools (Notion preferred)

 •  Experience with invoicing platforms (Square preferred)

 •  Clear, professional written communication skills

 •  Comfortable working in a fast-paced, multi-event environment where timelines matter



Why Join CCS?



At CCS, you’re not just managing vendors. You’re supporting a growing community of collectors, artists, and small business owners.



Your work directly impacts how vendors experience our events and how smoothly each event runs. If you care about building something meaningful and helping small businesses grow, this role gives you real impact inside a fast-growing marketplace.

This is a high-impact role within a team that values structure, growth, ownership, and collaboration. We believe strong systems build strong community, and every team member plays a part in that.

title: Marketing Professional (AI-Enabled Digital Marketing & Outreach)
description:
Healthcare & Human Service Consulting Group, LLC is seeking a Marketing Professional with expertise in AI-enabled marketing tools such as Blaze.AI, social media management, and online outreach. This role is integral to supporting the firm’s growth by expanding digital presence, increasing leads, and ensuring consistent, strategic branding across platforms.



Key Responsibilities:

AI-Enabled Marketing & Content Creation

Utilize Blaze.AI and other AI-powered platforms to draft, optimize, and schedule high-quality marketing content across channels.



Generate and implement data-driven marketing campaigns, including
 marketing sequences and automated outreach flows.



Continuously research and recommend emerging AI marketing tools to improve efficiency and impact.



Social Media Management & Online Outreach

Manage and grow the firm’s presence on LinkedIn,
, Instagram, and other relevant platforms.



Create, curate, and post engaging content to build brand awareness and community trust.



Monitor analytics to evaluate engagement, reach, and conversion metrics, adjusting strategies accordingly.



Engage with followers, respond to comments, and support online community building.



Sales & Lead Generation Support

Assist in developing and implementing digital outreach strategies to attract potential clients and partners.



Collaborate with sales team to align marketing efforts with service offerings and strategic goals.



Develop landing pages, forms, and automations within CRM or marketing software to capture and nurture leads.



Branding & Communications

Ensure all marketing content and outreach efforts align with H&HS Consulting Group’s brand voice, mission, and equity-centered approach.



Support development of marketing collateral, slide decks, and proposal templates as needed.



Contribute to storytelling strategies that highlight client impact and the firm’s consulting expertise.



Required Qualifications & Skills:



Bachelor's Degree or above in marketing (digital, content marketing). 



Strong business leadership experience and skills relating to marketing campaigns and/or brand development.



Minimum 2 years of experience in digital marketing, AI-enabled marketing, or online outreach roles.



Advanced proficiency with Blaze.AI and familiarity with other AI marketing software (e.g., Jasper, Copy.ai, ChatGPT-4 for marketing workflows).



Demonstrated success in managing social media channels for brands or organizations, with knowledge of platform-specific strategies.



Excellent written and visual communication skills.



Strong understanding of lead generation, marketing funnels, and nurturing sequences.



Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects in a remote environment.



Commitment to professional ethics, equity, and representing mission-driven brands.



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in marketing for consulting firms, nonprofits, healthcare, or human service organizations.



Familiarity with HubSpot CRM systems for marketing integration.



Basic graphic design skills using Canva, Adobe Spark, or similar tools.

title: A-Player Real Estate Media Buyer & Growth Architect
description:
Are you a Meta Ads Killer and Wizard? A Technical Operator who obsessed over ROI?



If so, I want to hire you immediately.



We are the elite in the real estate space, and we are looking for a Performance Media Buyer to own our client fulfillment. This is not a "task-based" job. This is a results-based partnership.



THE MISSION:



Your #1 priority is to ensure our real estate agents are drowning in high-quality, booked appointments. You will be responsible for the initial lifecycle of the lead: from the first impression on
 to the lead being qualified in GoHighLevel.



YOUR HIGH-LEVERAGE TASKS



Media Buying Excellence: Launching, managing, and scaling Meta Ads (FB/IG) specifically for Real Estate. You know how to pivot when CPL rises and how to double down on winners.



AI Creative Leverage: Using AI to rapidly produce ad copy and creatives that stop the scroll. No boring ads.



Technical Fulfillment: Executing full client onboarding. This means deploying GHL Snapshots, setting up FB Lead Forms, and ensuring the automation "plumbing" is leak-proof.



Data Integrity: Tracking every metric (CPL, CPM, CTR, Show-up Rate) in our master Sheets. If it isn't tracked, it didn't happen.



THE TECH STACK

Expert Level: Meta Ads Manager, GoHighLevel (Workflows & Snapshots).



Automation: Zapier / N8N (Chaining tools to increase speed).



AI: Deep knowledge of prompting ChatGPT/Gemini to write high-converting real estate scripts.



REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Speed is #1: You move faster than the competition. "Good and fast" beats "perfect and slow."



Extreme Ownership: If an ad set fails, you don't wait for me to tell you. You diagnose the constraint and fix it.



Fluent English: Radical transparency and clear communication are mandatory.



Technical Power: You own a 64-bit computer and a stable, high-speed internet connection.



Availability: Must be available at least 2-4 hours per day (to start) within US Timezones for syncs.



WHY MOST PEOPLE FAIL AT THIS ROLE:



Most Mediabuyers need to be micro-managed. If you need people to hold your hand or give you a "to-do list" every morning, do not apply. 



HOW TO APPLY (FOLLOW EXACTLY)



Send an
 to 
 Line: “Killer Media Buyer for Realty Rulers”



Note: We are an AI-first operation and have been leveraging these tools daily for 2+ years. If you send a canned, boring, generic application that was clearly copy-pasted from ChatGPT, you will be disqualified immediately.



Include a link to your OnlineJobs.ph profile.



Note: Please complete the questions in the Google form in order to be considered for this position. Forms that are not completed or only partially completed will not be considered. In the form you’ll be asked your age. Answer 42 to prove you’re paying attention to detail.



I look forward to working with you!

title: Outreach & Marketing Specialist (Email, WhatsApp & LinkedIn Automation)
description:
We are looking for an extremely proactive Outreach & Marketing Specialist who lives and breathes outbound engagement, lead nurturing, and conversion.



This role is not about posting content and waiting.

It’s about building conversations at scale, nurturing warm and cold leads intelligently, and turning outreach into booked meetings and revenue.



You will own and execute multi-channel outbound campaigns across
, WhatsApp, and LinkedIn, using modern automation tools while maintaining a highly personal, human touch.



If you enjoy testing messaging, improving reply rates, and obsessing over follow-ups, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities



Outbound Outreach & Campaign Execution

Build, launch, and optimise multi-step outbound campaigns across:



LinkedIn (connects, messages, follow-ups)

WhatsApp (via Wati.io or similar platforms)

Use tools like Lemlist to personalise outreach at scale (dynamic fields, images, video, custom variables)

Ensure consistent daily outbound activity with zero gaps in follow-ups

Lead Nurturing & Conversion

Design and manage long-term nurture sequences for:

Cold leads

Warm leads

Previously engaged prospects

Ensure no lead is ever “forgotten”

Progress leads from first touch ? conversation ? booked call

Adapt messaging based on lead behaviour, engagement, and intent

Messaging, Copy & Personalisation

Write high-converting outreach copy for:

Cold
s

Follow-up
s

LinkedIn messages

WhatsApp conversations

Test subject lines, CTAs, sequencing, and tone

Continuously refine messaging based on performance data

Tool & CRM Management



Work confidently with tools such as:



Lemlist 
 outreach & sequencing)

Wati.io (WhatsApp automation & inbox)

LinkedIn / Sales Navigator

CRM systems (e.g. HubSpot, Recruiterflow, Pipedrive, or similar)

Maintain clean, accurate lead data

Track and report on campaign performance

Performance & Optimisation



Monitor and improve:



Open rates

Reply rates

Positive response rates

Booked meetings

Identify drop-off points in campaigns and fix them

Bring ideas proactively to improve results (tools, tactics, messaging, sequences)



Required Experience & Skills

Must-Have



Proven experience in outbound outreach, lead generation, or growth marketing

Hands-on experience using Lemlist (or similar outbound
 tools)

Experience using WhatsApp automation tools (Wati.io or equivalent)

Strong working knowledge of LinkedIn outreach strategies

Demonstrated experience nurturing leads over time, not just one-off messages

Highly proactive, self-driven, and execution-focused

Comfortable working with targets and performance metrics



Nice-to-Have



Experience in recruitment, B2B services, SaaS, or real estate

Experience with video outreach (Loom, Vidyard, etc.)

Familiarity with CRM automation and tagging strategies

Understanding of sales funnels and buyer journeys



Personal Attributes We’re Looking For



Extremely proactive – you don’t wait to be told what to do

Detail-oriented but fast-moving

Obsessed with follow-ups and response rates

Comfortable testing, failing, and iterating quickly

Strong written communication and commercial awareness

Enjoys working in a performance-driven environment



What Success Looks Like in This Role



High reply rates across
, WhatsApp, and LinkedIn

Consistent flow of booked meetings

Clean, organised outreach systems

Leads feel nurtured, not spammed

Outreach campaigns improve month on month



Why Join Us



Work with a forward-thinking, AI-driven growth team

Access to modern tools, systems, and training

High ownership and autonomy

Clear performance expectations and progression opportunities



Opportunity to grow into a Head of Outreach / Growth role

title: Customer Service & Brand Support VA (Part-Time, ~20hrs/week)
description:
We're a growing fashion brand looking for a reliable, detail-oriented VA to join our small team. This is a part-time role with room to grow if you're a great fit.



What you'll be doing:

Your main focus will be managing customer service through our helpdesk software (Commslayer). Day-to-day this means responding to customer tickets, editing or updating orders in Shopify, chasing lost or delayed packages with our shipping carriers (including via phone — we'll provide everything you need for this), and coordinating with our fulfilment team on Slack when issues arise.



When CS is quiet, we'd love your help with influencer research (finding creators who'd be a good fit for the brand) and identifying small local retailers who might be interested in carrying our products.

One thing that would make you stand out: an ability to spot patterns in customer issues and flag insights that help us better understand our customers. This isn't just a ticket-closing role — we want someone who's curious and pays attention.



You're a great fit if you:

Have experience in e-commerce customer service

Are confident communicating professionally in English, including by phone

Are comfortable in Shopify or willing to learn quickly

Are organised, proactive, and don't need micromanaging

Able to work EST hours



To apply, please fill out this short form:

title: Longform Youtube Video Editor
description:
I'm looking for a reliable and consistent long-form video editor to help me produce content for my personal brand YouTube channel. The content is centered around music education and my music course, so the tone needs to be engaging, professional, and on-brand.



You'll receive raw footage fro
 and turn it into polished, ready-to-upload YouTube videos. I'll provide editing references, style direction, and ongoing feedback so you can lock in the look and feel quickly.

What You'll Be Doing:



Receive raw footage and edit full YouTube videos (typically 8–20+ minutes)

Clean up pacing, remove dead air, and tighten delivery throughout

Add text overlays, light effects, b-roll, zooms, and visual emphasis where appropriate

Keep the final product engaging while staying professional and on-brand

Export the finished video, upload to a provided Google Drive folder, and notify me on completion



Pay:

$9 USD per completed video. This is the flat rate regardless of video length within the 8–20+ minute range. You will see this listed on the job posting on the site as well — there is no separate or negotiated rate. If this doesn't work for you, this role isn't the right fit.

Requirements (Very Important):



CapCut Premium ONLY — no exceptions

Premiere Pro, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve, or any other software will not be accepted

Strong understanding of YouTube pacing for long-form content

Good English comprehension and clear communication

Reliable, consistent, and receptive to feedback

Experience editing educational or personal brand content is a strong plus



If you do not use CapCut Premium, your application will be automatically denied.

To Apply:

Please include:



Examples of long-form YouTube videos you've edited

Your availability per week

title: Meta Ads Manager
description:
Meta Ads Specialist (Full-Time | Australian Hours)



Company: Enrolment Boost

Industry: Australian Childcare Marketing

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Hours: Full-Time | Monday–Friday | 9am–5pm AEST



About Us



Enrolment Boost is a specialist marketing agency helping Australian childcare centres increase occupancy through high-performance digital advertising.



We are not a generalist agency.

We focus on one industry.

We execute with precision.



We are now hiring a full-time Meta Ads Specialist to take ownership of the technical execution and 
 of our
 & Instagram advertising campaigns.



This is not a junior role.

We are looking for someone who is extremely competent, detail-oriented, proactive, and confident in their expertise.



Your Core Responsibility



You will be responsible for the end-to-end execution and optimisation of Meta advertising campaigns.



This includes:



Campaign creation and structure strategy (TOF, MOF, BOF, retargeting)



Audience research and testing



Lead form setup and optimisation



Campaign budget allocation and scaling



Daily performance monitoring



Cost per lead optimisation



A/B testing (creative, copy, targeting, structure)



Troubleshooting rejected ads and account issues



Managing Business Manager settings and permissions



Ensuring pixel and event tracking accuracy



Reporting performance insights clearly and professionally



You will be expected to think strategically, not just “launch ads”.



Technical Skills Required



You must have:



Strong, proven experience running Meta Ads at scale



Deep understanding of Meta Business Manager



Experience structuring campaigns for lead generation



Clear knowledge of audience segmentation and testing frameworks



Ability to analyse metrics and optimise based on data



Strong understanding of:



CPL



CTR



Frequency



Relevance diagnostics



Hook rate



Creative fatigue



Experience handling lead quality issues and optimisation



Platforms & Tools



You must be confident using:



Meta Business Suite



Ads Manager



ClickUp



Slack



Google Sheets / reporting dashboards



Bonus Points (Highly Valued)



Experience with conversion tracking and event setup



Understanding of Meta Pixel and lead event tracking



Experience in the Australian childcare or education industry



Experience using AI tools for ad creative, copy testing, or performance analysis



Experience working within a structured SOP-driven agency



Communication Expectations



This role requires strong written and spoken English.



You must:



Communicate clearly and professionally



Provide performance summaries and insights



Proactively suggest improvements



Ask smart questions when needed



Work collaboratively within a team environment



We value initiative and ownership.



What This Role Is NOT



It is not a VA role.



It is not a “boost posts” role.



It is not a set-and-forget ad management position.



We are looking for a true Meta Ads specialist.



Working Conditions



Full-time role



Monday to Friday



Australian business hours (AEST)



Ongoing support and structured systems



Long-term opportunity with growth potential



How to Apply



Please include:



A short video introduction (2–3 minutes) explaining:



Your Meta Ads experience



Campaigns you have managed



Your optimisation process



Screenshots or examples of campaigns you have run



Your expected monthly salary in AUD



Confirmation that you can work Australian business hours

This is not a junior role and not a social media job.

 • Manage and execute website projects from start to finish

 • Work directly with internal teams and clients

This Role Is For You If

title: Research & Executive Outreach Coordinator – Professional Soccer Industry
description:
We are building a recruitment intelligence platform designed for professional soccer clubs internationally. The platform supports sporting directors and technical leadership with structured shortlists, player value evaluation, contract risk analysis, and executive-ready reporting.



We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Research & Executive Outreach Coordinator to help identify and initiate thoughtful conversations with senior football decision-makers (Sporting Directors, Technical Directors, General Managers).



This is NOT a mass sales or cold-calling role.



This is a precision, relationship-driven outreach position in a niche executive market.



---



**What You’ll Do**



* Research professional soccer clubs in targeted leagues (English and Spanish speaking markets)

* Identify correct executive decision-makers (Sporting Director, Head of Recruitment, Technical Director, etc.)

* Verify contact information through careful research

* Build and maintain a structured CRM database

* Send personalized LinkedIn connection requests and short introductory messages

* Track outreach progress and responses

* Coordinate meetings directly with the founder

* Assist with structured follow-ups when appropriate



Quality and professionalism are more important than volume.



---



**What We’re Looking For**



* Excellent written English (professional tone required)

* Strong research and verification skills

* Experience with LinkedIn outreach or B2B lead generation

* Highly organized and detail-oriented

* Must have your own active LinkedIn profile (include link in application)

* Ability to follow positioning guidelines exactly (no improvising messaging)



---



 **Strong Plus (Preferred but Not Required)**



* Spanish language proficiency (reading and writing)

* Experience researching within sports or professional organizations

* Experience communicating with executive-level decision makers

* Familiarity with CRM tools (Notion, Airtable, HubSpot, etc.)



---



**Important**



This industry is relationship-driven and reputation-sensitive.



We do NOT use:



* Bulk
 blasts

* Mass automation tools

* Aggressive sales scripts



All outreach must be personalized and approved in advance.



---



 **Compensation**



Part-time (10–20 hours per week)

Long-term opportunity if performance is strong.



Compensation based on experience.



---



 **To Apply**



Please include:



1. A 3-sentence LinkedIn message you would send to a Sporting Director at a professional soccer club.

2. A short explanation of how you would verify the correct decision-maker at a club.

3. A link to your LinkedIn profile.

4. Confirmation that you understand this role requires thoughtful, non-spam outreach.



Applications without these items will not be considered.

title: TikTok Shop & Social Media Manager
description:
Job Opportunity: TikTok & Social Media VA (Full-Time, Remote)



About Velomix

Velomix is a top-performing fitness brand and the #1 best-selling protein shaker brand on Amazon US. We dominate the shaker bottle category on Amazon and are now growing fast on TikTok Shop.

We’re looking for a TikTok & Social Media VA to help manage our TikTok Shop and support other social channels. TikTok Shop experience is a plus but not required — we’ll train you.

-Full-time, remote position

-Main focus: TikTok Shop

, Instagram, YouTube



You’ll be part operator, part marketer — organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable working with creators

Create and optimize product listings (titles, images, videos, descriptions, bundles)

Daily Operations & Customer Support

Tracking & Reporting

Other Social & Marketing Support

 campaigns

What We’re Looking For

Must-Have:

-Confident communicating via DMs and

-Strong written English

Compensation & Probationary Period

What We Offer

title: Executive Assistant (A+ Level Only)
description:
Executive Assistant (A+ Level Only)



We are seeking a high-caliber Executive Assistant to support a fast-moving CEO and leadership team.

This is not an entry-level administrative role. We are looking for a proactive, detail-obsessed operator who protects executive time, ensures priorities move forward, and keeps communication and execution organized at a high level.



The right person anticipates needs, solves problems early, and brings clarity to complexity. You thrive in dynamic environments, think critically, and take ownership without waiting for direction.

You are calm under pressure, highly organized, emotionally intelligent, and deeply reliable.



Core Responsibilities



Executive Support & Time Protection

• Manage complex calendar scheduling and prioritization

• Protect executive time and ensure alignment with strategic goals

• Monitor and manage executive inboxes

• Draft and edit professional communications

• Prepare daily or weekly executive briefings



Meeting & Communication Management

• Coordinate internal and external meetings

• Prepare agendas and supporting materials

• Capture and distribute meeting summaries and action items

• Track follow-ups to ensure completion

• Maintain organized documentation of key decisions



Operational Coordination

• Maintain CRM accuracy and data integrity

• Ensure proper documentation of leads and client records

• Support onboarding and offboarding coordination

• Monitor key administrative workflows and flag issues



Reporting & Organization

• Compile executive reports and performance summaries

• Maintain organized digital filing systems

• Support documentation of SOPs and internal processes



Confidential & Strategic Support

• Handle sensitive information with discretion

• Assist with planning and coordination of strategic initiatives

• Provide structured thinking and clarity when priorities shift



Non-Negotiables

• Proven experience supporting executives or founders

• Exceptional written and verbal English

• Strong organizational and prioritization skills

• High emotional intelligence and professional maturity

• Ability to operate independently with minimal supervision

• Extreme ownership mindset

• High integrity and confidentiality



Application Requirements



To be considered, submit:



1. A 2–3 Minute Video

Please answer:

• Your experience supporting senior executives

• A complex situation you successfully managed

• A time you prevented a problem before it escalated

• Why you consider yourself an A+ Executive Assistant

• Why Savage CEO would be a good fit?

Website: 
/

: www.
/TheSavageSecrets

Youtube: 



2. Resume + Tools Proficiency List

Include the systems and platforms you’ve used (CRM, Microsoft products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), scheduling tools, Google Workspace, project management software, etc.).



3. Send your applications to 
 with subject "Executive Assistant - "Full name"

title: Website Designer (WordPress + Shopify)
description:
Role Overview:

We're a fast-growing digital marketing agency and consultancy working with clients across finance, professional services, and ecommerce. We combine sharp strategy with AI-powered systems to deliver results, and we're scaling quickly.



We're looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Website Designer experienced in both Shopify and WordPress

(Elementor preferred). You should have a strong eye for design that converts, a solid grasp of on-page SEO fundamentals, and — most importantly — an entrepreneurial mindset. We don't micromanage. We want someone who takes ownership, solves problems independently, and grows with the business.



In return, you'll get hands-on training in cutting-edge AI tools, AI agents, and the systems reshaping digital marketing. But we're looking for self-starters and fast learners — not people who need hand-holding.



Key Responsibilities:

Able to design asethetically pleasing website from scratch in WordPress (Elementor) and Shopify.

Customise templates or design from following brand guidelines.

Implement basic on-page SEO (meta tags, headers, keyword placement, internal linking).

Ensure websites are mobile-optimised and load quickly.

Conduct quality checks to ensure usability, speed, and SEO readiness.

Use AI to write SEO-optimised service pages to support content marketing efforts using SOPs.



Requirements:

Proven experience designing websites in WordPress and Shopify at another agency (at least 4-5 years+).

Strong sense of design and understanding of UI/UX for conversions.

Proficiency with Elementor (or similar page builders).

Working knowledge of SEO fundamentals (title tags, alt tags, schema basics).

Experience with mobile optimisation, speed performance, and user-friendly layouts.

Understanding of marketing funnels and user journeys.

Strong communication and ability to work to deadlines.

Strong knowledge of branding and webdesign systems.

Familiarity with CRO (Conversion Rate Optimisation) best practices.

Experience with schema markup, page speed tools, and analytics.



Preferred Skills:

Ability to write clear, engaging SEO articles (preferred but not required)

Comfort managing multiple web and content projects at once.

Ability to use a Miro board to map out funnel designs



Why Join Us:

Be part of an up-and-coming agency that is growing quickly.

Get access to and learn the latest AI agent tools so you don't get left behind.



How to Apply:

Please submit apply using this link: 



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Flexible Reddit Task (Charts Posting)
description:
We’re looking for a few people to help post high-quality charts and data to different Reddit communities.



What you’ll do:

1. Post our charts to 3 different subreddits per day

2. Each post must be in a different subreddit

3. No repeating the same subreddit for at least 30 days



Important:

1. No career or job-related subreddits

2. Subreddits must have at least 10,000 weekly visitors

3. You must have good judgment on which communities fit each chart



Note:

1. Audience is US-based

2. Image posting only. No long writing needed

3. We will provide the charts and tracking sheet.



Time required:

1. About 10 to 15 minutes per day

2. Fully flexible schedule



Requirements:

1. Experience using Reddit

2. Good understanding of what performs well on Reddit

3. Careful and responsible posting behavior

4. Must be able to avoid spam and bans



Pay:

PHP 1,500 for 100 posts



To apply, please include:

1. How long you’ve been using Reddit

2. Link to the Reddit account you will use

3. Choose 3 non-career subreddits where you would post this chart and explain why each is a good fit



4. For each subreddit, write the post title you would use



This is a small, flexible task, not a full-time job.
