title: Medical Virtual Assistant
description:
Medical Virtual Assistant

Weight Loss and Wellness Clinic

Remote | Full Time | US Healthcare Support | $6/hour

Please read the job description completely, as instructions on how to proceed are included within it.



Role Summary

We are seeking a high performing Medical Virtual Assistant who understands that operational accuracy directly impacts patient care, provider efficiency, and revenue integrity. 



In this role, you will serve as a key operational support partner for the clinic, ensuring patients are scheduled correctly, insurance is verified accurately, and referral and authorization workflows move forward without delays.



Top Requirement: Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal) 



Key Responsibilities



1) Appointment Scheduling and Patient Coordination

— Manage inbound and outbound appointment scheduling (new and established patients) via phone calls,
 and text message

— Maintain and optimize provider calendars to prevent gaps, overlaps, and double booking

— Confirm appointments and handle reschedules, cancellations, and waitlist coordination

— Conduct pre visit outreach for readiness, reminders, and next steps

— Ensure accurate appointment notes and patient demographics are entered in the system



2) Insurance Verification and Benefits

— Verify eligibility and benefits before appointments

— Confirm copays, deductibles, covered services, and authorization requirements

— Identify coverage issues early and communicate clearly with patients and internal teams

— Document verification results accurately in the EMR and internal trackers

— Escalate complex payer issues and follow through until resolved



3) Referral Intake and Referral Management

— Process inbound and outbound referrals and ensure all required documents are complete

— Coordinate with referring providers and specialist offices for scheduling and status updates

— Track referral progress from intake to completion, including follow ups and missing items

— Maintain accurate documentation and ensure referrals meet payer or clinic requirements



4) Prior Authorization (PA) Support

— Initiate and submit prior authorization requests with required clinical documentation

— Follow up on pending requests and communicate outcomes to appropriate stakeholders

— Track approvals, denials, and expirations to prevent care delays or claim issues

— Coordinate resubmissions and additional documentation requests when needed



5) Administrative Support and Documentation

— Maintain accurate records and consistent documentation practices

— Follow HIPAA compliant handling of patient information

— Support day to day clinic admin tasks as assigned (messages, forms, uploads, task queues)

— Work is subject to periodic Manager review.



Required Qualifications

— Strong verbal and written English communication (patient friendly and professional)

— Highly organized, detail oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks without missing deadlines

— Comfortable working independently, documenting clearly, and providing status updates proactively

— Reliable computer, headset, and stable internet for remote work



Preferred Qualifications

— Experience working with EMR/EHR systems (any platform)



Experience in:

— Appointment scheduling and calendar management

— Insurance verification and benefits checks

— Referral handling (inbound and outbound)

— Prior authorizations and payer follow up

— Familiarity with common payer workflows, portals, and terminology

— Experience supporting primary care, specialty clinics, or telehealth practices

— HIPAA training or strong knowledge of HIPAA compliant workflows



What We Value

— Clear, confident communication

— Ownership and proactive follow up

— Accuracy and consistency in documentation

— Calm and professional handling of patients and payer conversations

— Team mindset with a focus on improving clinic operations

— Open to feedback without taking it personally.



If you would like to be considered, please complete this form

title: Go High Level CRM engineer
description:
HighLevel (GoHighLevel) CRM Systems Engineer



Company: Raleigh Screen Solutions

Location: Remote

Position Type: Contract (Project-Based with Potential Ongoing Retainer)



About Us



Raleigh Screen Solutions is a premium outdoor living construction company specializing in custom screen porches, sunrooms, EZE-Breeze systems, motorized screens, decks, and structural additions. We operate in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment and are seeking to fully optimize our CRM, automation, and lead management systems to support continued expansion.



We are looking for a highly qualified GoHighLevel (HighLevel) CRM Systems Engineer to architect, implement, and optimize our CRM infrastructure from the ground up.



Position Overview



This is not a basic setup role. We are seeking a strategic, technical expert who can:



Design and build a fully integrated CRM ecosystem



Implement advanced automations and workflows



Optimize lead routing and pipeline management



Integrate third-party tools (ads, forms, calendars, payment systems, etc.)



Improve internal operational efficiency through system architecture



The ideal candidate has extensive hands-on experience with GoHighLevel in service-based or construction-related businesses and understands both marketing automation and operational workflows.



Responsibilities:

Audit existing HighLevel account structure and provide strategic recommendations



Build and customize pipelines for residential and commercial divisions



Develop advanced automation workflows (lead nurture, follow-ups, reactivation, review requests, etc.)



Configure integrations (Google Ads, Meta Ads, website forms, Zapier, QuickBooks, Stripe, calendars, etc.)



Implement tagging, segmentation, and reporting dashboards



Set up SMS,
, voi
 drops, and campaign triggers



Optimize lead tracking and ROI reporting



Ensure system cleanliness, scalability, and long-term usability



Train internal team members on proper CRM usage and SOPs



Requirements:

Proven experience implementing and scaling GoHighLevel CRM systems



Minimum 3+ years of CRM systems engineering or marketing automation experience



Strong knowledge of workflow automation, triggers, and API integrations



Experience integrating payment systems and accounting platforms



Ability to design clean, scalable CRM architecture



Strong problem-solving and process-mapping skills



Excellent communication and documentation skills



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with construction, home services, or contractor-based businesses



Familiarity with sales pipelines for high-ticket service projects



Experience building KPI dashboards and performance reporting



Ability to advise on CRM strategy beyond just technical implementation



To Apply:

Please submit:



Resume



Portfolio or examples of HighLevel systems you have built



Description of a CRM system you architected and the results it produced



Your project-based or hourly rate



Availability timeline



Qualified candidates will be contacted for a discovery call.

title: 3D Rendering designer
description:
Online CAD Designer (Remote)

We need a candidate who can build and layout custom visual renderings for residential contractor jobs. 

We have a project management app. So, we would like to see someone who can take photos of existing homes, and add on the build that we are quoting to the clients to present a visual idea for the project. 



Company: Raleigh Screen Solutions

Location: Remote 

Position Type: Contract / Part-Time (with potential for ongoing work)



About Us



Raleigh Screen Solutions is a premium outdoor living construction company specializing in custom screen porches, sunrooms, EZE-Breeze systems, motorized screens, decks, and structural additions. We focus on high-end residential projects and detailed, build-ready design packages.



We are seeking an experienced Online CAD Designer to support our growing volume of residential outdoor living projects.



Position Overview



The ideal candidate will have strong residential construction drafting experience and be capable of producing accurate, detailed CAD drawings suitable for permitting, engineering review, and client presentation. This role requires attention to detail, understanding of structural framing concepts, and the ability to interpret site photos, sketches, and field measurements.



Responsibilities



Create detailed 2D (and optional 3D) CAD drawings from sketches, photos, and scope descriptions



Produce permit-ready plan sets (floor plans, elevations, sections, framing details)



Draft structural framing layouts (LVLs, beams, posts, rafters, roof pitch details)



Revise drawings based on field feedback and client change requests



Maintain organized file structure and version control



Communicate clearly and efficiently regarding revisions and project requirements



Requirements:

Minimum 3 years of CAD experience (residential construction preferred)



Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, Chief Architect, or comparable CAD software



Strong understanding of residential framing and building concepts



Ability to produce accurate dimensioned drawings



Experience preparing plans for permitting is highly preferred



Strong communication skills and reliability in meeting deadlines



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with screen porches, decks, sunrooms, or light structural additions



Familiarity with North Carolina residential building codes (a plus)



Ability to create presentation-ready renderings



To Apply:

Please submit the following:



Resume (including relevant CAD experience)



Portfolio or examples of past projects (PDF or link)



Brief description of your experience with residential construction drafting



Your hourly rate or project-based pricing structure



Qualified candidates will be contacted for a short virtual interview.

title: B2B Sales Executive - North American Markets
description:
The Role

We're looking for a proven B2B sales closer who knows how to hunt, qualify, and close deals in the North American market. This is a 100% sales-focused role—no marketing, no social media, just pure sales execution.

You'll be responsible for the entire sales cycle: prospecting, outbound calling, running demos, handling objections, negotiating, and closing deals with sales teams, revenue operations leaders, and sales enablement professionals across the USA and Canada.

This role is for you ONLY if:



You have proven B2B sales experience selling to US and Canadian markets

You're comfortable making high-volume outbound calls daily

You have a documented track record of meeting or exceeding quota

You can close deals independently without hand-holding

You're available to start immediately



If you don't have B2B sales experience selling to North American markets, please do not apply.





Key Responsibilities

Prospecting & Lead Generation



Research and identify target accounts in the sales tech, revenue operations, and B2B SaaS space across USA and Canada

Build and maintain a robust pipeline of qualified opportunities

Use multiple channels (cold calling,
, LinkedIn) to reach decision-makers

Qualify leads based on fit, budget, authority, need, and timeline (BANT)



Outbound Calling & Client Engagement



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospects daily (50-100+ dials)

Conduct discovery calls to understand prospect pain points and business challenges

Articulate Intentrack AI's value proposition clearly and compellingly

Book qualified product demonstrations with decision-makers



Sales Presentations & Demos



Lead product demonstrations showcasing Intentrack AI's capabilities

Tailor presentations to address specific prospect needs and use cases

Differentiate our platform from competitors (ZoomInfo, 
, 6sense, etc.)

Handle technical questions and objections confidently



Deal Management & Closing



Move prospects through the sales pipeline systematically

Overcome objections and address concerns throughout the sales cycle

Negotiate pricing and contract terms within approved parameters

Close deals and achieve monthly sales targets consistently

Ensure smooth handoff to customer success for onboarding



CRM & Sales Reporting



Maintain accurate records of all sales activities in CRM (calls,
s, meetings, notes)

Track pipeline health and forecast monthly revenue accurately

Provide weekly sales reports including: calls made, meetings booked, demos conducted, deals closed

Analyze win/loss patterns to continuously improve sales approach



Required Qualifications

Non-Negotiable Requirements:

Sales Experience:



Minimum 2-3 years of B2B sales experience with proven quota achievement

Must have sold to USA and/or Canadian markets (this is mandatory)

Demonstrated success with outbound sales and cold calling

Track record of consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets (provide specific metrics)

Experience selling SaaS, sales tools, marketing technology, or similar solutions strongly preferred



Sales Skills:



Excellent phone presence and communication skills

Strong objection handling and negotiation abilities

Ability to understand technical products and explain them clearly to non-technical buyers

Experience with full sales cycle management (prospecting to close)

Self-motivated and disciplined—able to work independently without supervision



Technical Requirements:



Proficient with CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce, Pipedrive, or similar)

Comfortable with sales engagement tools (Outreach, Apollo, SalesLoft, etc.)

Experience with video conferencing tools (Zoom, Google Meet, Teams)



Logistics:



Must be available during North American business hours (Eastern, Central, Mountain, or Pacific time zones)

Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

Immediate availability to start (within 1-2 weeks)



Compensation Structure

Total Monthly Earning Potential: Up to $3,000 USD



Base Salary: $1,000 USD/month (fixed)

Performance Commission: Up to $2,000 USD/month based on sales targets



Commission Tiers:

Tiered commission structure rewards consistent performance and growth. Commissions are paid based on closed Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) and number of deals closed. Detailed commission slabs will be shared during the interview process.





What We're Looking For

Your Ideal Profile:



You're a hunter, not an order-taker—you thrive on prospecting and outbound sales

You have receipts—you can show us your quota attainment, deals closed, and revenue generated

You understand the B2B SaaS sales cycle and can navigate complex buying processes

You're coachable but don't need micromanagement

You're comfortable with rejection and persistent in follow-up

You can speak the language of sales leaders, RevOps teams, and sales enablement professionals



Red Flags (Do Not Apply If):



You've only done inbound sales or account management

You have no experience selling to North American markets

You need extensive training on basic sales skills

You're not comfortable with high-volume outbound calling

You can't provide specific metrics from your previous sales roles

title: independent ERP Consultant for SME
description:
Key Responsibilities:



Meet with key departments (Finance, Operations, HR, etc.) to understand current processes, pain points, and requirements.



Document business requirements and create a clear Excel-based ERP brief for internal review.



Conduct market research to identify potential ERP vendors and solutions and reach out to, evaluate, and interview up to 10 ERP providers.



Assess vendor capabilities, fit, and costs against business requirements with weighting scoring, with detailed testing of every important feature.



Shortlist the top 3 ERP solutions and present recommendations to leadership and arrange vendor demo's of these and put together total costs for each solution against functionality.



Assist in planning the initial implementation approach for the chosen ERP, there may be a phase two of supporting implimentation



Maintain organized documentation of all evaluations and decisions.

title: SDR

You’ll handle a mix of administrative, marketing, and operational work — managing listings, CRM data, vendors, and marketing content. This is a long-term opportunity to grow your career while working directly with a client who values ownership, independence, and professional communication.

title: LinkedIn Engagement and Community Specialist
description:
Role Overview:



We are seeking a 
munity Manager with a proven track record to lead and enhance our social media presence on LinkedIn. This role is pivotal in driving brand visibility, fostering meaningful engagement, and contributing to business growth. You will work closely with our content and copywriting teams to transform content into engaging LinkedIn posts, strategically incorporating tags, hashtags, and other platform-specific features. If you are looking for a traditional "lead generation" role, this position is not for you.



Key Responsibilities:

Strategic Content Management: Collaborate with our content and copywriting teams to adapt and optimise content for LinkedIn, ensuring posts are engaging and aligned with our strategic goals. This includes selecting appropriate tags, hashtags, and other LinkedIn features to maximise reach and impact.

Engagement and Community Building: Actively engage with new and existing audiences by initiating conversations, tagging relevant individuals and organisations, and fostering meaningful interactions that drive brand awareness and community growth.

Trend Monitoring and Adaptation: Stay ahead of industry trends and LinkedIn platform updates, using insights to recommend new strategies and content formats that keep our brand relevant and engaging.

Performance Analysis: Regularly track and analyse LinkedIn metrics, providing actionable insights and reports to refine our content strategy and optimise engagement.

Collaborative Integration: Work seamlessly with internal teams to ensure LinkedIn initiatives align with broader marketing strategies, contributing to the overall success of our campaigns.

Profile Optimisation: Continuously review and optimise LinkedIn profiles to maximise visibility, reach, and impact across all our LinkedIn activities.

Responsive Communication: Manage inquiries and feedback on LinkedIn promptly and professionally, ensuring our community feels heard and valued.



Key Skills and Competencies:



LinkedIn Expertise: Deep understanding of LinkedIn’s platform features, tools, and best practices, with at least 2 years of professional experience managing LinkedIn accounts for businesses or clients.

Content Optimisation: Ability to work with content and copywriting teams to turn content into engaging LinkedIn posts, utilising tags, hashtags, and other features to enhance visibility.

Analytical Mindset: Proficient in using LinkedIn metrics and analytics to drive performance improvements and inform content strategies.

Collaborative Spirit: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, integrating LinkedIn efforts with broader marketing and business goals.

Proactive and Trend-Focused: A keen eye for spotting emerging trends on LinkedIn and the initiative to implement them in our strategies.

Strong Communication: Excellent written communication skills, with an emphasis on clarity, creativity, and attention to detail.

Organisational Skills: Capable of managing multiple tasks and projects simultaneously while maintaining a high level of quality and consistency.



Qualifications and Experience:



Professional Experience: Minimum of 2 years managing LinkedIn accounts for businesses or clients.

Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.

Platform Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of LinkedIn’s platform features, tools, and best practices.

Content Optimisation: Experience in adapting and optimising content for LinkedIn to enhance engagement.

Analytical Skills: Demonstrable experience with LinkedIn metrics and analytics for performance tracking and improvement.

title: Customer Support Representative (E-commerce Brand)
description:
About the Role

We are a fast-growing e-commerce brand seeking a dedicated, long-term Customer Service professional to join our team. As we scale significantly this year, we are looking for a candidate who represents our brand with authority, dedication, and a "customer-first" mindset.



For the right person, this role offers substantial growth opportunities within our company. You will follow a clear, streamlined process that ensures our customers receive elite support every time they reach out.



Required Technical Knowledge:

- Shopify (Order management and customer data)

- Slack (Internal team communication)

- Google Drive / Gmail (Documentation and correspondence)

- ChatGPT/AI LLM's (Assisting with high-quality, efficient responses)



Key Responsibilities:

- Inquiry Management: Responding to customer
s regarding order tracking, refunds, and technical product FAQs.

- Speed & Accuracy: Maintaining a 16-hour response time (ETA) with precise, professional communication.

- Reporting: Providing updates on refund trends and common customer complaints.

- Process Improvement: Contributing to our internal documentation (SOPs) to help us sharpen our support operations.

- Professionalism: Representing a tactical brand with a calm, helpful, and direct communication style.



What We Provide:

- Comprehensive training modules.

- Clear Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for every scenario.

- Direct access to our Lead Customer Support for mentorship and questions.



Applicant Requirements:

- Experience: Minimum 1 year in E-commerce Customer Support.

- Language: Fluent written and verbal English (Native or C1 level).

- Commitment: This is a long-term role. You must be available for team calls and active in Slack.

- Attention to Detail: We have zero tolerance for "lazy" support (e.g., sending the same
 twice, imprecise answers, or off-topic responses).

- Digital office: Fast internet, fast computer/laptop, no outages.

- Availability: Must be available to start immediately and not currently holding another full-time position.



Work Schedule & Trial Period:

Phase 1: A two-week paid trial period with extensive training.

Phase 2: Transition to Part-Time (minimum 18 hours per week to start, scaling up as needed).

Phase 3: Transition to Full-Time (30+ hours)



How to Apply:

Please submit your proposal and include:

- A brief summary of your previous experience in e-commerce support.

- Why you believe you are the right fit for a high-standard e-commerce brand.

- Confirmation that you can meet our 16-hour response time requirement.



And please answer on these screening questions:



Question 1

It's Tuesday morning. You open the inbox and see 14 unanswered
s. 3 of them are close to hitting the 16-hour window. 4 are from the same customer who sent follow-ups. 2 are complaints about a product defect you've never seen reported before. The rest are general inquiries. Walk me through exactly what you do in the next 30 minutes, in order.



Question 2

A customer
s saying they want a refund. You check the order: they are outside the refund window by 2 days, but they've ordered from Stonewall 4 times before. There is no policy exception for loyal customers written in the SOPs. What do you do, and what do you say to them?



Question 3

A customer
s: 'Hi, I placed an order 3 weeks ago, order #
. I just want to know where it is.' They say nothing else. But when you check the order, it shows delivered 10 days ago. Write the
 you would send back.



Question 5 

You've been on shift for 6 hours. It's been a frustrating day: two difficult customers in a row, a system glitch that lost one of your drafted replies, and you just found out a colleague submitted incorrect tracking info to 7 customers, and those tickets are now landing in your queue to fix. How are you actually feeling right now, and what do you do next?



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Executive Finance & Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
Romance & Dance is seeking a highly organized, detail-driven Executive Finance & Operations Virtual Assistant to support the CEO and oversee administrative and financial coordination across multiple studio locations.



This role focuses on financial organization, operational tracking, payroll coordination, compliance monitoring, and executive support. This is NOT a marketing or social media position. The ideal candidate is structured, proactive, financially literate, and comfortable working with numbers and systems.



Key Responsibilities

Executive & Administrative Support

*Manage CEO calendar, scheduling, and follow-ups

*Organize and maintain Google Drive and digital filing systems

*Maintain vendor database and contract repository

*Prepare internal reports and operational summaries

*Track insurance, permits, and license renewal deadlines

*Maintain confidentiality of all financial and personnel data



Financial Administrative Management

*Upload, categorize, and organize receipts in QuickBooks

*Maintain organized expense documentation for audit readiness

*Track subscriptions and recurring business expenses

*Maintain vendor payment schedule and due dates

*Track inventory purchases and merchandise costs

*Maintain capital expenditure log (equipment, poles, build-outs)

*Flag duplicate, unusual, or high-risk transactions

*Prepare weekly expense and cash summary for CEO

*Support cleanup organization for 2023–2025 financial records



Payroll & Contractor Coordination

*Maintain W9 and contractor agreement files

*Track payroll allocations by studio location

*Coordinate payroll documentation with bookkeeper

*Track 1099 contractors and employee documentation

*Ensure payroll records are properly stored and accessible



Operational Financial Reporting

*Track weekly KPIs per studio:

       *Revenue

       *Membership count

       *New sign-ups

       *Cancellations

mbers. Advancement comes with a pay increase and commission opportunities.

mbers.

mbers for efficient customer support operations.

 communication.

title: Full Stack Developer – .NET, Azure & REST APIs | Remote for Canadian FINTECH
description:
About the Role:

L’EVATE Inc., on behalf of a leading Canadian FINTECH client, is seeking a results-driven Full Stack Developer with 5+ years of experience 
, Azure, SQL, and REST APIs. If you are passionate about building secure, scalable, and high-performance applications and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, this role is for you!



You’ll work closely with a global team, integrating DevOps practices, automation, and test-driven development into everything you do. This is a fantastic opportunity to grow your career while making a direct impact on innovative financial technology solutions.



Key Responsibilities:



Full Stack Development

- Design, develop, and maintain robust web applications using C#, .NET Core, and React (preferred)

- Write clean, maintainable, and testable code using object-oriented principles and SOLID practices

- Build RESTful APIs and backend services for front-end applications and third-party integrations

- Optimize application performance and troubleshoot issues across 
 codebase



Database & Azure Integration

- Develop complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and database schemas on SQL Server or Azure SQL

- Integrate and deploy services on Microsoft Azure: App Services, Functions, Logic Apps, Storage, Key Vaults

- Utilize Azure DevOps for version control, CI/CD pipelines, and release management

- Collaborate with QA teams to ensure backend logic, API endpoints, and business workflows are thoroughly tested



Agile & DevOps Collaboration

- Participate actively in agile ceremonies: daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives

- Work cross-functionally with QA, DevOps, and Product teams to deliver high-quality releases

- Contribute to continuous integration and delivery workflows to reduce time-to-market



Quality & Continuous Improvement

- Support code reviews, peer programming, and mentoring within the development team

- Identify and remediate bottlenecks in system performance, maintainability, or architecture

- Advocate for engineering best practices, automation, and test-driven development



Required Qualifications:

- 5+ years as a Full Stack Developer with strong backend expertise in C# 
 Core

- Experience developing and consuming RESTful APIs, with knowledge of API security and versioning

- Hands-on experience with SQL Server and complex query optimization

- Solid knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication/authorization, and vulnerability management

- Experience with Azure PaaS offerings: App Services, Functions, and Azure DevOps

- Proficiency in unit and integration testing frameworks (xUnit, NUnit)

- Exposure to test automation and CI/CD workflows

- Familiarity with Git and agile methodologies

- Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills



Preferred Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

- Experience integrating with AI-powered services or platforms

- Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and Azure container services

- Knowledge of performance testing tools such as JMeter or Load Testing



Vetting Task (Pre-Screening Assignment):

To help us identify top talent, please submit:

1. A short code snippet (50–100 lines) in C#/.NET demonstrating a REST API endpoint, including basic unit tests

2. Brief answers to these questions:

- Describe a complex SQL query you optimized

- Explain how you implemented CI/CD in a previous project

- Share an example of an Azure service integration you completed



Candidates who complete this task thoughtfully will be prioritized.



Why Join Us:

- 100% Remote role with a dynamic Canadian FINTECH team

- Competitive compensation based on skills & experience

- Opportunity to work on cutting-edge financial technology projects and grow your career



How to Apply:

Submit your resume along with your vetting task via onlinejobs.ph. Include [Job Title] in the subject line. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
